sources.full: The Adventures of Torrin Campaign Setting

entries: While wearing this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. You can also use a bonus action to speak the armor's command word and cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or remove the armor.

You have a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the sword can store up to 3 charges. Any time you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage the sword gains a charge. The sword loses any unused charges on the next dawn.

For every charge the sword has, it deals an additional d6 of damage. You determine the type of damage based on the number rolled on one of the d6s, you choose each time you deal damage with the sword. The table below determines the damage type.
You have resistance to necrotic damage while wearing this armor.

This set of armor is forged while being soaked in the blood of a demon. When you take damage from an attack made with a weapon, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the size of your hemomancy die. If you do not have a hemomancy die, the temporary hit points gained becomes a d4.
You have a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This weapon is forged while being soaked in the blood of a demon. When you hit with an attack using this magic weapon, you deal an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to the size of your hemomancy die. If you do not have a hemomancy die, the bonus becomes a d4.
On hit, you also gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage you dealt from this weapon.
You have resistance to cold damage while wearing this armor.

This set of armor is forged while being quenched in freezing cold oils and mixed with the blood of cold-blooded monsters. When you are hit by a melee attack from a creature within 5 feet of you, shards of ice spray onto the attacker, dealing 1d6 cold damage. This damage increases to 1d8 when in arctic environments or in freezing cold temperatures. You can only deal this damage to a creature once a round per creature.
You have a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This weapon is forged while being quenched in freezing cold oils and mixed with the blood of cold-blooded monsters. When you hit with an attack using this magic weapon, you deal an extra 1d6 of cold damage. When in an arctic environment or in freezing cold temperatures, this bonus increases to 1d8.
On hit, you also reduce the target’s movement speed by 10 feet. You can only incur this penalty to a creature once a round per creature you hit.

item.name: Goblet of Refreshment
entries: A creature may drink from this empty silver goblet once per day without suffering any penalties. When they do, it fills with fresh water and they receive enough water that is needed for the day. If a creature who has already drank from this goblet attempts to drink from it again on the same day, they must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they are poisoned until it is removed. A remove curse can also remove the poison. Regardless if they fail or save, they do not gain the benefits of drinking from the goblet.
This goblet is often found in churches, usually being used as a charity tool to keep the poor from dying from dehydration.

item.name: Pendant of Perfection
entries: While wearing this pendant, you can adjust your appearance and vocals in the following ways, using any combination of effects:

items: You and your clothing is spotless, almost sparkly even!
You appear as if you were lighter (lean) or heavier (chubby), depending on your preference.
You appear as if you were toned or clad with muscles, depending on your preference.
You can make the pitch of your voice higher or lower, depending on your preference. This change is not enough to change your voice drastically, as if to sound like another person.
You appear as if your face was smooth and clean shaved, or you can appear to have facial hair of any preference.

entries: Regardless of the effects you don, these magical effects give you a boost to your charisma, allowing you to have advantage on Charisma ability checks. The effects can be detected as an illusion on a successful DC 10 Intelligence (Investigation) check.

item.name: Bracelets of Far Speak
entries: This pair of bracelets are linked to each other. You can cast the message spell, but instead of pointing in the direction of the message, it instead is sent to the creature wearing the other linked bracelet. You can only send messages to the other linked bracelet when casting it through this magic item.

item.name: Winter's Oath
entries: {@i "Souls lost in the frozen wastes find their path at winter’s end. They who wield this sword shall guide the lost and protect the weak till winter’s final end."}

This mithral shortsword was combined with the goddess of winter’s magical essence which was scattered in the frozen wastelands upon its creation, granting it special properties. Its power grows with its wielder, however one who cannot control its might shall be frozen in time for eternity.
You can use a bonus action to release a cold flame from the weapon, which lasts until it is sheathed. While the flame is released, it deals an additional 1d6 cold damage.

entries.name: Cold Flame
entries: You can use a bonus action to release a cold flame from the weapon, which lasts until it is sheathed. While the flame is released, it deals an additional 1d6 cold damage.

entries.name: Cold Embrace
entries: As an action you can choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Unless they have resistance or immunity to cold damage, their body temperature immediately drops to -30 degrees fahrenheit. They make a DC 13 constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 cold damage on a failed save or half as much on a success and suffer from the effects of extreme cold, gaining a level of exhaustion. Their body temperature remains this way for 1 minute, or until you end it early as a bonus action. Once you’ve used this property you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Icy Glow
entries: This magical sword glows when in freezing cold temperatures. In areas of extreme cold, the sword sheds bright light out to a range of 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

entries.name: Freezing Aura
entries: While holding this shortsword, you may shed an aura of extreme cold. As an action you can activate this aura, which affects creatures you choose within 10 feet of you. Each creature makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 13) or takes 1d6 cold damage and gains one level of exhaustion. A creature can only gain one level of exhaustion in this way, it can however stack with any previous levels of exhaustion or any it gains after the one gained from this one, so long as it is from a different source.

You may dismiss the freezing aura as at any time, no action required. Once dismissed, you cannot activate this aura again until the next dawn. The aura is automatically dismissed whenever you finish a short or long rest after activating it.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The shortsword grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You can speak, read, and write Elvish and Primordial.
You have resistance to cold damage and do not suffer the effects of difficult terrain created by ice and snow.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: The shortsword grants the following benefits in its awakened state:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
The cold damage dealt when you release the cold flames increases to 2d6.
The saving throw DC for the weapon's Cold Embrace and Freezing Aura increases to 15.

While holding the shortsword, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 15, +7 to hit): {@spell cold snap|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, {@spell creeping cold|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, {@spell glacial grip|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, or {@spell winter’s grasp|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}. Once a spell has been cast using the shortsword, that spell can't be cast from the shortsword again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: The shortsword grants the following benefits in its exalted state:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
The saving throw DC for the weapon's Cold Embrace, Freezing Aura, and spells cast from the weapon increases to 17 and the spell attack bonus becomes +9.
You have immunity to cold damage.
The cold damage dealt when you release the cold flames increases to 3d6.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: In its dormant state, the wielder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} and {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

entries.name: Destroying the Sword
entries: Destroying Winter's Oath is no easy feat, as is with any artifact. The sword is tied to the essence god or goddess of winter. In order to render the sword useless, the god or goddess tied to the sword must be destroyed completely. The sword then reverts to an ordinary shortsword made of mithral. It retains its magical bonus to hit, but otherwise retains non of its other magical abilities. However, the sword even still cannot be destroyed by normal means, and must be thrown into a volcano from the 1st layer of hell, Avernas, to finally destroy the weapon.

item.name: Mantle of Snow
entries: This white mantle allows the wearer to move quickly through ice and snow. You ignore the effects of difficult terrain caused by ice and snow. In addition, while traversing through ice or snow your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

As a bonus action while wearing the mantle, you can use the mantle to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you, leaving behind a trail of snow between where you were and where you teleported. The snow melts away after 10 minutes.

item.name: Terry's Exploding Sphere
entries: This steel sphere feels hot to the touch and seems to shake constantly. As an action, you can throw this heavy ball up to 20 feet. If you have a strength score of 15 or higher, you can throw this ball up to 40 feet and with a strength score of 18 or higher then you can throw it 60 feet.

On impact, the sphere explodes at the point it is thrown. Each creature within a 10-foot-radius sphere from where it explodes must make a DC  15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 4d10 force damage and are deafened. On a success, they take half damage and are not deafened.

After the explosion, a smaller ball that weighs half as much as the original remains in the center of the explosion. After which, the ball can be thrown again, but the amount of damage dice rolled on the explosion is halved. After the second throw, the sphere is fully destroyed.

item.name: Cabinet of Sustenance
entries: This wooden cabinet shimmers with magic and the faint smell of roast beef, potatoes, and sizzling onions can be sensed when nearby it. A creature may pull out a chunk of raw meat, a potato, and an onion from this cabinet. A creature may only do so once per day per creature, resetting for that creature at the next dawn. When properly prepared, the meal provides enough sustenance to serve as 1 day of rations. If a creature attempts to pull food out from the cabinet for a second time, they are given a Bead of Nourishment instead, which only lasts for 24 hours until it disappears. The third time results in nothing.

Once a cabinet has been used a total of 50 times, it becomes an ordinary non-magical cabinet for the next 30 days. After the 30 days, the cabinet regains its magical properties and functions as normal for another 50 uses.

item.name: Apron of The Chef
entries: This apron has a faint but pleasant smell that resembles a person’s favorite meal. While wearing this apron, you have a +5 bonus to ability checks made when using Cook’s Utensils. In addition, when you cook a meal during a short rest, every creature that ate the food you prepared regains an additional amount of hit points equal to one roll of their hit die.

item.name: Bottled Familiar
entries: This corked bottle has a puff of smoke inside of it. A creature can speak the command word and remove the cork, releasing the smoke. Doing so, you cast the find familiar spell and the smoke forms into the familiar. When the smoke is released and forms a familiar, the bottle becomes an ordinary non-magical bottle. Once the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, it cannot be summoned again.

item.name: Blood Vial
entries: This magic vial is soulbound to a demon and contains droplets of its blood, which refills on its own at the start of a new day. The vial has 3 charges, each charge represents a special die called a hemomancy die. Each hemomancy die is a d4 and unlike ordinary hemomancy dice, you do not take damage when you use them. You can spend charges from this item to make use of any hemomancy features you may have.
You can spend one or more charges to use these hemomancy dice in the following ways:

items: (1 or up to 3 charges) As a bonus action you can roll a hemomancy die for each charge spent and regain a number of hit points equal to the result.

(1 or 2 charges) Whenever you deal damage to a creature, you can roll one or two hemomancy dice depending on how many charges you spent and add bonus necrotic damage to that creature equal to the number rolled on the hemomancy dice.
(1 charge) As a reaction, you can roll the hemomancy die and add the number to any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

entries: When the vial loses a charge, some of the blood in the vial vanishes as it is used for the magic inside. When all of its charges are spent, there is only a shrivel of a drop left. The vial regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn, which refills the vial.

item.name: Divination Focus
entries: A fate weaver has the powers of divination and most use a special tool that allows them to see into the near future, recent past, or present time. Every fate weaver is proficient with a divination focus, but other spellcasters can use a Divination Focus if they are proficient with one.

A divination focus can take many different forms ranging from a blank deck of cards that can fit writing or pictures, a sphere with a die inside that provides a written response, a tarokka deck, or even a small candle stick that when used its smoke forms words or an image.

Regardless of the form the focus takes, you start a 10 minute ritual and ask a single question. You then make a Spellcasting ability check and add your proficiency bonus using the divination focus. In order to receive an accurate reading, you must make a DC 12 check, or a DC determined by the DM depending on the nature of your question. More specific questions usually incur a higher DC. If your check is successful, you receive a vague response up to 50 words in length. Alternatively, you can receive a visual representation and interpret the meaning of the message yourself. You can use a Divination Focus a number of times per day equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining expended uses daily at dawn.

item.name: Instrument of the Forest, Kotone
entries: Through the forest there are many melodies to be heard, from the soft winds to the falling petals the forest’s true beauty is through the senses of the beholder. This lyre was forged by the goddess of nature for the protector of her domain. Her chosen champion. To which it was named after the first to wield such a powerful artifact, Kotone.

entries.name: Voice of the Forest
entries: Whispers can be heard from this artifact. You can cast the spell {@spell Commune with Nature} using the instrument as the focus for the spell. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand  Elvish, Primordial, and Sylvan.

entries.name: Protector's Soul
entries: A creature attuned to this item gains the power to protect their allies. As a reaction when a creature takes damage within 60 ft of you, you can choose to reduce that damage to 0. When you do so, you receive a token of burden. The next time you would take damage while you have a token of burden, you take twice the amount of damage you would have normally taken and the token of burden is lost.

entries.name: Musical Weapon
entries: The music played by Kotone can be focused into magical attacks. As an action, make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 60 ft of you using your spell attack modifier. On hit, you deal 1d6 plus your charisma modifier thunder damage.

entries.name: Flexible Instrument
entries: Kotone can take the shape of any musical instrument of your choice, to change its form requires a bonus action. If you have attuned to an instrument of the bards before of any variety, you can change Kotone into that magic item, granting Kotone the properties of that instrument in addition to its own properties but only when it takes the form of that instrument.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The instrument grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You are always under the effects of the Speak with Animals and Speak with Plants. You can also speak, read, and write Aquan, Sylvan, and Teran.

Using the instrument as the material needed for the spell, you can ritual cast {@spell Augury}. You play a melody as part of the casting of the spell, to which a perfectly tuned song shows sign of weal, a poor tuned song as a sign of woe, an uninspired tune as both weal and woe, and a silent melody as neither weal or woe.
Your spell attack and save dc both increases by 1.

{@b Song of Healing.} As an action, you can call the spirits of the forest to your beckon call to aid your allies. You conjure an amount of fey spirits equal to twice your proficiency bonus. These fey spirits hover around you. You can use a bonus action to send a fey spirit toward a creature you can see within 60ft of you. The spirit disperses and then heals that creature for 3d6 hit points. Alternatively, instead of healing these spirits can remove one disease or condition listed by lesser restoration. Once you’ve used your song of healing, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the instrument reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: {@b Instrument of War.} You can use a bonus action to transform this instrument into any weapon you have wielded for a duration longer than seven days of which you are proficient with. If the weapon was not magical, it gains a magic bonus of +2. If it was a magical weapon, it gains the properties of that magic weapon in addition to its own but only when it takes the form of that weapon.
The Musical Weapon damage increases by 1d6 and your spell attack and save dc increases by 1.

While holding the instrument, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it using your spellcasting ability without requiring material components: {@spell faerie fire}, {@spell mass cure wounds} (6th level), {@spell lesser restoration}, or {@spell greater restoration}. Once a spell has been cast, that spell can't be cast from the instrument again until the next dawn.

{@b Song of War.} You can bolster your allies with the songs of battle. As bonus action you can give a number of allies up to your charisma modifier temporary hit points equal to your level. While they have these temporary hit points, they are immune to being charmed or frightened and have advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. You can use this song a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and cannot use it again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the instrument reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The Musical Weapon damage increases by 1d6 and your spell attack and save dc increases by 1.

{@b Song of Restoration.} As an action you can begin a song of continuous healing. For the next minute, you and each friendly creature within 30 ft of you restores 2d6 hit points at the start of each of their turns. Once you use this song, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

{@b Song of Retribution.} As a bonus action you can begin a song that leaves a path of destruction for any who dare to harm the wilderness. For the next minute, you and each friendly creature within 30 ft of you receives a bonus to their damage rolls equal to your proficiency bonus. Once you use this song, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

{@b Protector's Grove.} You can cast the {@spell Druid Grove|XGE} spell once with this instrument without requiring material components or spending a spell slot, regaining the ability to do so again the next dawn.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to Kotone in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

item.name: The Blade of The Neverending Storm, Ragnarok
entries: Legends tell of a blade as old as the world itself, some say as old as time. Before creation comes ruin, and ruin is what created this weapon. Forged by a mortal with the power of the Gods of Old in the eye of a never-ending storm, let no evil touch this blade; lest you bring ruin and the end of all things. This weapon has been an heirloom in the Blade Family for countless generations, its name given by its original owner, Ragnarok. The Blade family is a long line of heroes that focuses on compassion and love to all walks of life. Striking down the unredeemable ones, hoping they are reborn better. Lending a hand to those in need, to those who seek redemption, and to those that cannot protect themselves.

A powerful hum can be heard from the weapon. A creature that meditates in front of the blade will hear the ambience of a thunderstorm, and may even see visions of a powerful hero that now lies dormant within the blade. The blade itself radiates electricity with the might of a dragon.

entries.name: Spirit of Ragnarok
entries: A voice can be heard from the blade from time to time. While attuned with the weapon you can communicate with the spirit inside the blade, Ragnarok. Ragnarok is a genius with magic, and knows just about anything about it. No matter how hard, rare, or impossible the magic may be to know, he knows about it to some degree. Though, unless absolutely necessary he will not share all of his knowledge. The most cursed of magic he’ll keep to himself unless encountered with it, or if a weakness needs to be known. Ragnarok is kind and benevolent. If he finds that his wielder becomes tainted or cursed, he will ensure that they either become pure again, or grants them a swift painless death so they no longer suffer from the sins they would regret later in life.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common, Draconic, and Primordial.

entries.name: Deadly
entries: This weapon cannot be used non-lethally and will always count as a killing strike.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The katana grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You can speak, read, and write Auran and Draconic.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, and it deals an extra 1d8 lightning damage to any target it hits. Immediately after you make a ranged attack with this weapon, it flies back to your hand. You can also call the weapon using a bonus action.

{@b Lightning Absorption.} As a reaction, whenever you are targeted by a spell, magical effect, or attack (not originating from you) that would deal lightning damage, you can instead reduce that damage to 0, and regain hit points equal to the original amount. This property can’t be used again until the next dawn.
You can spend an action to cast the fly spell but only targeting yourself. This property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the katana reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2, and the extra lightning damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d8.
The lightning absorption property can be used twice before the next dawn.
This weapon counts as a {@item Staff of Thunder and Lightning|DMG}, gaining its properties.

While holding the katana, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 17, +9 to hit): {@spell lightning bolt} (6th level), {@spell chain lightning}, {@spell storm sphere|XGE}, or {@spell call lightning} (6th level). You can use your own spellcasting ability if you have one when casting these spells. Once a spell has been cast using the katana, that spell can't be cast from the katana again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the katana reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
The lightning absorption property can be used three times before the next dawn.
The saving throw DC for the weapon's special properties and spells cast from the weapon increases to 19 and the spell attack becomes + 11.
While holding the katana, you can use an action to cast {@spell control weather} from it. You can use your own spellcasting ability if you have one when casting these spells.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to Ragnarok in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

item.name: The Bow of Judgement, Yumiko
entries: Forged by the old god of death, this powerful bow swiftly takes the lives of anyone in its sights, so long as its wielder wishes it so. This deadly bow was entrusted to a tiefling who understood the weight of such power and the responsibilities that come with it. And so, the tiefling Yumiko, who swore to only kill those deserving, took this legendary bow and used it to smite all evil that was unfortunate enough to fall under their keen eye.

entries.name: Necrotic Ammunition
entries: By pulling back the bowstring of this weapon you can make your own ammunition without the need of having any in your possession. When you do so however, the bow does 1d6 necrotic damage instead of 1d8 of piercing. You do not add your dexterity bonus to the damage roll of attacks made with this ammunition.
If you do use normal ammunition for the bow, you deal an additional 1d6 necrotic damage on hit.

entries.name: Sight of Judgement
entries: As an action you can shift your focus onto the soul of a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Make a Wisdom (Insight) check contested against their Charisma (Deception) check. On a success, you learn that creature’s alignment and creature type. On a failure, you learn nothing.
You can use this special sense a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus regaining the ability to use it again at the next dawn.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The longbow grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

{@b Death Shot.} When you hit a creature with this magic weapon you can deal a lethal blow. The creature makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, on a failed save the creature takes 4d8 necrotic damage and has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. On a success it takes half as much damage and does not suffer disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. Once you’ve used Death Shot, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.
{@b Homing Shot.} When you would miss with an attack roll using this weapon, you can choose to reroll the attack with a -5 penalty to the damage roll if you hit.

{@b Death Shot.} While holding this longbow you can cast hex from it without requiring components or spending a spell slot. When you do so, its range becomes the normal range of the longbow instead. Once you’ve cast this spell using the longbow, you cannot cast it again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the longbow reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2. Both the extra necrotic damage and the damage dealt by your Necrotic Ammunition increases by 1d6.
You can use Death Shot and Mark of Death twice per dawn instead of once.
The longbow counts as a {@item longbow of certain death|EGW}, gaining its properties in addition to its own.

{@b Soul Shattering Shot.} When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can turn all of the damage from this attack into force damage and the creature makes a DC 17 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save they take 8d8 force damage and are stunned until the end of your next turn. If they cannot be stunned, they are instead incapactiated and their movement speed is reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn. On a success, they take half damage and are not stunned or incapactiated. Once you’ve used Soul Shattering Shot you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the longbow reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3. Both the extra necrotic damage and the damage dealt by your Necrotic Ammunition increases by 1d6.

{@b Slaying Shot.} When you score a critical hit using this weapon and their remaining hit points after the attack is 100 or fewer, that creature must make a DC 19 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature dies. On a success, the creature instead takes 10d10 necrotic damage and is incapacitated until the end of your next turn. You can use this slaying shot three times and you regain all uses at dawn.
You can use Homing Shot and Mark of Death three times per dawn instead of twice.

While holding the longbow, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it without requiring components (save DC 19): {@spell Time Ravage|EGW}, {@spell Abi-Dalzim's Horrid Wilting}. Once a spell has been cast using the longbow, that spell can't be cast from the longbow again until the next dawn.
The save DC for Death Shot, Soul Shattering Shot, and the DC for spells cast using this weapon becomes 19 instead of 17.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to Yumiko in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

item.name: Hammer of the Allfather, Iryoku
entries: When the world shakes, it can be one of two things. An earthquake, or this mighty hammer has been swung. This hammer’s weight is incalculable to those unworthy of its might but weightless to its true wielders. The original wielder of this mighty warhammer, Iryoku, was chosen by the allfather himself to wield this mighty earth-shaking weapon to defend the dwarven kingdom to his last dying breath.

entries.name: Dwarvn Endurance
entries: This warhammer counts as a {@item Belt of Dwarvenkind|DMG}, gaining its properties in addition to its own except the Constitution score increase maximum is 22 instead of 20.

entries.name: Might of The Dwarvish Lords
entries: Only a creature attuned to this warhammer can gain the benefit of its light property. Otherwise it counts as a heavy weapon. Being worthy of this hammer grants you a might stronger than the sturdiest steel walls. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The warhammer grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
{@b Flames of the Forge.} When you hit a creature with this weapon, you deal an extra 1d8 fire damage.

{@b Powerful Strikes.} Each time you hit a creature with this weapon they must make a DC 15 strength saving throw or be pushed back 5 feet. Each blow lets out a thunderous boom that can be heard from 100 feet away.

{@b Quaking Strike.} When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force them to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. Once you’ve used this property you cannot do so again until the next dawn. Regardless of the save, the target takes an extra 2d6 bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the warhammer reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2. The extra fire damage you deal with Flames of the Forge becomes 2d8 instead of 1d8.
You can use Quaking Strike twice per dawn instead of once.
The warhammer counts as a {@item Dwarven Thrower|DMG}, gaining its properties in addition to its own.

{@b Earth Shattering Smash.} You use all of your might to strike down at the ground, causing the earth beneath you to crack and rise up. You cast the {@spell Bones of the Earth|XGE} and {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} spells using this warhammer, the DC for the spells are 17. Once you’ve cast either of these spells using this warhammer, you cannot cast that spell again until the next dawn.
The save DC for Powerful Strikes, Quaking Strike, and the spells cast from this warhammer becomes 17 instead of 15.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the warhammer reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.

{@b Might of The Allfather.} Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 2. While wielding this warhammer, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. In addition, if an effect moves you against your will along the ground, you can use your reaction to reduce the distance you are moved by up to 10 feet.
You can use Quaking Strike three times per dawn instead of twice.

While holding the warhammer, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it without requiring components (save DC 19): {@spell Earthquake}, {@spell Move Earth}. Once a spell has been cast using the warhammer, that spell can't be cast from the warhammer again until the next dawn.
The save DC for Powerful Strikes, Quaking Strike, and the spells cast from this warhammer becomes 19 instead of 17.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to Iryoku in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

item.name: The Sword of Legend, Excalibur
entries: There is an inscription written on the blade of this weapon. The inscription is written in Celestial: {@i "He who shall wield the hilt of this legendary blade; shall possess the courage and strength of the greatest hero known to mankind. The sealer of darkness and king of men, Excalibur."}

Also known as the sword of evil’s bane, the darkness sealing blade, arms of the true king, and many other names. This sword is forged by the holiest of steel and righteous gold mined from Mount Celestia. Its power reverberates in its wielder’s hand, and has the strength to harm even the mightiest of foes. Only they who should ever be worthy can release the blade from its prison. Even the gods cannot break the seal on this artifact.

This longsword belonged to the legendary hero Adam Alexandr. “Excalibur” was the name he donned after choosing to become a hero instead of a ruler. The weapon chooses who can attune to it and who can't. It desires a wielder who embodies bravery, compassion, and heroism.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The sword allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest. The first time you attune to the sword, you are transformed into a heavenly, idealized version of yourself, blessed with otherworldly beauty and a touch of heaven in your heart. Neither magic nor divine intervention can reverse this transformation. Your alignment becomes lawful good, and you gain the following traits:

items: {@b Angelic Language.} You can speak, read, and write Celestial.
{@b Celestial Resistance.} You have resistance to necrotic and radiant damage.

{@b Holy Light.} The sword sheds 5ft of dim light. Whenever you hit with a weapon attack using this sword, the sword deals an additional 1d10 amount of radiant damage. This damage becomes 2d10 against an evil aligned creature. The sword’s holy glow becomes brighter the closer you are to an evil aligned creature. When you are within 10 ft of a creature with an evil alignment, the sword sheds 5 ft of bright light and dim light for an additional 5 ft. The sword tells its wielder telepathically who or what the evil creature is when it detects it. A magic item or spell that blocks divination magic blocks this ability.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The longsword grants grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

{@b Evil's Bane.} As an action, you can subdue evil’s might using this legendary sword. Choose any number of evil aligned creatures you can see within 10 feet of you, those creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws while within 10 feet of you for the next minute. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

{@b Divine Protection.} As an action, you can cast the {@spell protection from evil and good} spell once using this sword without spending a spell slot or requiring material components. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until the next dawn. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
{@b Divine Might.} You can use your charisma modifier for the attack and damage rolls of this weapon instead of strength.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: The longsword grants grants the following benefits in its awakened state:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
You can use Evil’s Bane and Divine Protection twice per dawn instead of once.

{@b Angelic Wings.} You sprout a beautiful pair of feathered wings that grant you a flying speed of 90 feet and the ability to hover. If you already have a different kind of wings, these new wings replace the old ones, which fall off.

While holding the longsword, you can use an action to cast {@spell Tasha's Otherworldly Guise|TCE} (You can only choose the upper planes option). Once the spell has been cast using the longsword, it can't be cast from the longsword again until the next dawn. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: The longsword grants the following benefits in its exalted state:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3. The damage dealt by this longsword ignores any resistance and immunities when dealing damage to an evil aligned creature.
{@b Eyes of the Divine.} Your eyes become luminous pools of silver. You gain truesight out to a range of 60 feet.
You can use Evil’s Bane and Divine Protection three times per dawn instead of twice.

While holding the longsword, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 20): {@spell Holy Aura}, {@spell Imprisonment}. Once a spell has been cast using the longsword, that spell can't be cast from the longsword again until the next dawn. You can cast {@spell imprisonment} with its original casting time instead. An evil creature automatically fails the saving throw for imprisonment, but only if you cast it using its full casting time instead of an action. For the purposes of the imprisonment, the creature is sealed within the sword and cannot be released by any means short of a properly worded {@spell wish}., even so there is a 30 percent chance the wish can fail.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: In its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} and {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

item.name: Retractable Shield
entries: A bracer with a trigger system that when triggered unleashes a shield and when triggered again it retracts back. This shield grants you a +2 Bonus to AC when released, and no bonus when retracted. You can spend a free item interaction during your turn to trigger, and a reaction to trigger it not on your turn. While the shield is released you get an additional + 1 to AC.

item.name: Fannigan's Fancy Folding Kitchen
entries: When you release the brass latch on this small 6x6 inch wooden case it opens to reveal a miniaturized replica of a field kitchen. The kitchen includes a stove/oven combo, a water basin, a table, and an Ice Box. The floor of the replica also has a button that when pressed causes the replica to slowly expand until it has reached full size (for a medium creature). The kitchen can be placed on any surface with a height difference of no more than 4 feet across a 10 foot square. As it expands it will deploy stands, braces, and stairs to stabilize the kitchen and provide easy access to its facilities.

When expanded, the field kitchen is fully usable to prepare, cook, and clean up after meals. The Ice Box can be used to store up to 100 lbs. of perishable foodstuffs which it will help to preserve for much longer than normal. In addition the Ice Box contains a magical compartment that when asked politely, will produce just enough of any spice, seasoning, or breading needed to prepare the current meal.

When the kitchen is done being used, another button can be found on the top of the stove which, when pressed will cause the kitchen to slowly shrink back to its original size. The once again miniaturized kitchen can then be folded up and packed away for easy transportation.

item.name: Ragnarok's Adorning Cloth
entries: This magical cloth magically fits itself to its wearer by speaking its command word in elvish. A creature can assign a new command word when it is not being worn by another creature by spending 10 minutes with the item repeating the command word while touching the cloth. The new command word must be in elvish. A creature can repeat the command word to magically disrobe the adorning cloth.

The clothing can take the appearance of any piece of clothing so long as its wearer has seen the article of clothing before, or the wearer can make their own design by imagining it in their mind. The cloth can change its color, length, thickness, and all other properties when being worn. When the cloth is not being worn, it returns to being a regular looking piece of white cloth.

The cloth can become either a single article of clothing or a full set of clothing, depending on what the creature prefers when speaking the command word. Any material that is made from the cloth can only be cloth, for example it cannot make metal accessories as part of the adorning process.

item.name: Ragnarok's Shard of Storms
entries: This crackling crystal contains the essence of a raging tempest. As an action, you can attach the shard to a Tiny object (such as a weapon or a piece of jewelry) or detach it. It falls off if your attunement to it ends. You can use the shard as a spellcasting focus while you hold or wear it.
When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use the following property:

entries.name: Property
entries: You create a surge of electricity originating from you in a 10ft radius. Each creature of your choice that you can see in that area takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

item.name: Amulet of Concentration
entries: This Amulet has three dull gems. When you cast a spell that requires concentration one of the gems begins to glow. While glowing the gem helps hold concentration on the spell, allowing you to concentrate on another spell. When all three gems are glowing, you cannot concentrate on antoher spell.
When you would roll a concentration check to maintain concentration on these spells, if you fail you lose concentration on all of the spells you are concentrating on and the gems become dull again.
If all of the gems started to glow, when they become dull you cannot use the magic from this amulet again until the next dawn.

item.name: Wand of Weather Detection
entries: This thin wooden wand has 3 charges. You can expend one of its charges to cast the {@spell druidcraft} spell, but you can only predict the weather when casting the cantrip in this way.
The wand regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand flares up in sparks and is destroyed.

item.name: Lost Sword of The Forgotten Hero
entries: This elven-made longsword appears lighter than it should be. You can feel something powerful from the blade but it appears to be faint. A subtle hum can be felt from the blade from time to time, mayhaps more power lies within it, a dormant hidden power.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The longsword grants grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You can speak, read, and write Elvish and Sylvan.
You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, being attuned to the rapier increases the range of your darkvision by 60 feet.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

{@b Blade of Light.} You can use an action to cause the blade to glow with radiant energy. For a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus, the blade emits a bright light out to a range of 30 ft and dim light out to an additional 30 ft. While emitting this light, its damage becomes radiant instead of slashing and it deals an additional 1d8 radiant damage on hit (1d10 if you were wielding it with two hands). Once you’ve used this benefit, you can’t use it again until the next dawn.

{@b Guiding Hero.} While holding this blade if you fail an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to reroll the d20 taking the new result potentially causing a success. Once you’ve used this benefit you cannot use it again until the next dawn.
{@b Dormant Hero.} While holding this blade you have advantage on saving throws made against being charmed or frightened.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: The longsword grants grants the following benefits in its awakened state:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
{@b Awakened Critical.} Whenever you score a critical hit using this weapon, you deal an additional 1d8 slashing damage (1d10 if you were wielding it with two hands).
{@b Awakened Hero.} While holding this blade you are immune to being frightened and have resistance to radiant and necrotic damage.
You can use your Guiding Hand and Blade of Light benefits twice per dawn instead of once.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: The longsword grants the following benefits in its exalted state:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.

{@b Exalted Hero.} While attuned to this weapon, you are immune to being charmed and frightened and cannot be aged magically. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws made against harmful effects.
{@b Boon of Heroic Deeds.} Choose one of the Epic Boons found in pg 232 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide. You gain the benefits of that boon while attuned to this weapon.
You can use your Guiding Hand and Blade of Light benefits three times per dawn instead of twice.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: In its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} and {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

item.name: Memori's Memento
entries: This magical longbow is made with a fine oakwood found in the finest woods of the Arda Kingdom and reinforced with elven crafted gold. It constantly gleams with magic. It was handcrafted by Memori Blade, a hero with legendary feats.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Songstress of the Elements
entries: You can cast the {@spell Flame Arrows|XGE} and {@spell Lightning Arrow} spells, each once as a bonus action from this magical longbow, without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. You regain the ability to cast each of these spells at the next dawn.

entries.name: Minstrel's Wrath
entries: When you hit with the weapon, you deal an additional {@damage 2d8} points of psychic damage. In addition, when you score a critical hit with the weapon, you can regain one expended use of your bardic inspiration. Alternatively, if you have the maximum number of bardic inspiration, you can regain one of your lowest level of expended spell slots.

entries.name: Inspiring Shot
entries: When you hit with an attack made with this magic weapon, choose one other  creature within 60 feet of you. That creature can add a {@dice 1d6} to their next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. You can only give this benefit once per round.

item.name: Robe of Acidic Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to acid damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Icy Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to cold damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Fiery Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to fire damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Shocking Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to lightning damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Toxic Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to poison damage.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Robe of Thunderous Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to thunder damage
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

item.name: Primordial Brand Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo is brightly colored, usually coming in hues of red, blue, green, or yellow.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Elemental Essence
entries: You have resistance to one of the following damage types chosen by your DM: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. In addition, melee or ranged attacks made with weapons or unarmed strikes deal an additional 1d6 damage of the chosen type.

entries.name: Elemental Burst
entries: As an action, you can call upon the power of this tattoo, causing it to glow with immense power. Make a special ranged spell attack with a +7 to hit with a range of 60 feet and no long range. The target takes 4d6 points of damage. The type of damage is determined by the type chosen for Elemental Essence. Hit or miss, the elemental magic explodes, causing the target and each creature within 5 feet of the target to make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 2d6 of the aforementioned damage, or half as much on a success. Once you’ve used this ability, the tattoo’s glow dims and you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Cloak of Energy Absorbption
entries: Woven by a special silk and harnessing primordial energies, this cloak protects the user from elemental magic.

As a reaction while wearing the cloak whenever you would take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can reduce that damage to 0 and gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage you would have taken. In addition, you have resistance to that damage type for 1 hour. If you were to take more than one of the listed damage types from the same source, you choose one of the damage types to absorb, not all of them.
Once you’ve used the property of this cloak, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Wraps of The Stormbringer
entries: These magical wrappings have electricity coursing within them, waiting to be released. You have a +1 to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes and your unarmed strikes are treated as magical for the purposes of overcoming non-magical resistances. The wraps have 10 charges.

When you hit with a weapon attack or unarmed strike while wearing these magical wraps, you can expend 1 or more of these charges to deal an additional 1d6 points of lightning damage, to a maximum of 4 charges spent.

In addition, you can expend 1 or more of these charges to cast one of the following spells from the wrappings without expending a spell slot or requiring material components (Spell Save DC 17, +9 to hit): {@spell lightning bolt} (3 charges), {@spell storm sphere|XGE} (4 charges), {@spell chain lightning} (6 charges).
The wraps regain {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Bracelet of Fire
entries: This gold bracelet is imbued with the flames of an elder phoenix, granting its wearer powerful fire magic. You have a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls while wearing this bracelet. The bracelet has 10 charges.

While wearing this bracelet, you can expend one or more of its charges (to a maximum of 3) as a reaction when a creature hits you with an attack while within 30 feet of you. That creature is then immediately ignited with powerful flames. They take 1d10 points of fire damage per charge spent.

You can expend one or more of its charges to cast the following spells through it, without spending a spell slot or requiring material components (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit): {@spell burning touch|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (1 charge), {@spell scorching ray} (2 charges), {@spell Melf's minute meteors|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell fire shield} (4 charges), or {@spell immolation|XGE} (5 charges).
The bracelet regain {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Storm Branded Scimitar
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, on hit the weapon deals an additional 1d6 lightning damage and the creature cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Hammer of Thunderous Might
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, on hit the weapon deals an additional 1d6 thunder damage and the creature is pushed back 5 feet.

item.name: Amulet of The Bottomless Seas
entries: This amulet with an ocean blue jade embedded within it holds a magical power that grants its wearer unique control over the seas and its creatures. When you hear the heartbeat of the ocean, you know the ruins the amulet was placed in is near, worn by the deceased King of the Seas. It is said that whoever wears this amulet becomes the true ruler of the seas.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest.

entries.name: Protection of The Seas
entries: You have resistance to cold damage and damage dealt by creatures with a swimming speed, regardless of origin. While submerged underwater, the seas protect you from any incoming damage, granting you resistance to all damage except force or psychic.

entries.name: Sea Legs
entries: You are granted a magical swimming speed equal to twice your base movement speed and can breathe underwater as you do air. In addition, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against being knocked prone.

entries.name: Master of The Seas
entries: You can speak with any beast, monstrosity, or elemental that has an innate swimming speed, even if it does not share a language with you. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks against creatures with an innate swimming speed. You can also cast {@spell command} and {@spell dominate monster} (DC 19) on said creatures at will and they have disadvantage on their saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Tidal Magic
entries: You are granted a unique control over the seas, allowing you to cast the following spells without requiring material components or expending a spell slot (Spell Save DC 19): {@spell control water} (at will), {@spell water splash|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (at will), {@spell create or destroy water} (at will), {@spell water whack|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (at will), {@spell whelm|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (3/day), {@spell tidal wave|XGE} (3/day), {@spell water breathing} (3/day), {@spell water walk} (3/day), {@spell water wall|XGE} (3/day), {@spell investiture of water|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (1/day), {@spell tsunami} (1/day)

entries.name: Elemental Servants
entries: As an action, you can summon up to five {@creature water elemental|MM|water elementals} or one {@creature leviathan|MTF} under your control. They obey your commands and regard you as a friend. Once you’ve used this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn. The elementals are destroyed when they reach 0 hit points, or when you use this feature again.

item.name: Crown of Eternal Flames
entries: This iron crown burns an everlasting fire when worn that grants its wearer a strong authority over fire and  creatures from the elemental plane of fire. Wearing this crown makes your eyes glow like burning coals and cinders emit from your body.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest.

entries.name: Flame Walker
entries: You have immunity to fire damage. You ignore difficult terrain created by fire, lava, molten rock, or the like and you can walk on lava as if you were walking on solid land. Your speed is doubled when traversing through such terrain. While standing in fire, or an area that would deal fire damage to creatures, you have resistance to all damage except force and psychic.

entries.name: Fiery Form
entries: You can use a bonus action to assume a fiery form or revert to your normal form. While your fiery form is active, you can move through spaces as narrow as 1 inch. You can occupy the space occupied by another creature. If you end your turn in their space, they take 2d6 fire damage. If you are hit by a melee attack and take damage while your fiery form is active, the attacker takes fire damage equal to your level. While your fiery form is active, your attacks and spells deal additional fire damage equal to your level. While your fiery form is active, you shed bright light out to a range of 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You can freely change the range of both the bright and dim light to be as short as 5 feet for both, or as far as 60 ft for both.

entries.name: Master of The Flames
entries: You can speak with any elemental creature that either has resistance or immunity to fire damage, regardless if you share a language or not. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks against elementals with a resistance or immunity to fire. You can also cast {@spell command} and {@spell dominate monster} (DC 19) on said creatures at will and they have disadvantage on their saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Flamebringer
entries: You are granted a unique control over fire, allowing you to cast the following spells without requiring material components or expending a spell slot (Spell Save DC 19, +11 to hit) : {@spell control flames|XGE} (at will), {@spell produce flame} (at will), {@spell burning touch|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (at will), {@spell continual flame|XGE} (at will)  {@spell flaming sphere} (at will), {@spell fireball} 3/day), {@spell wall of fire} (3/day), {@spell immolation|XGE} (3/day), {@spell investiture of flame|XGE} (1/day), {@spell fire storm} (1/day)

entries.name: Elemental Servants
entries: As an action, you can summon up to five {@creature fire elemental|MM|fire elementals} or one {@creature phoenix|MTF} under your control. They obey your commands and regard you as a friend. Once you’ve used this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn. The elementals are destroyed when they reach 0 hit points, or when you use this feature again.

item.name: Cloak of The Boundless Skies
entries: This feathered cloak constantly billows gently, regardless if there is any wind or not. Wearing this cloak gives you authority over the skies and the creatures among it.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest.

entries.name: Sky Dancer
entries: You have resistance to damage dealt by creatures with a flying speed and you have a magical flying speed of 150 feet.

entries.name: Weather Lord
entries: You can cast control weather at will and the casting time of it for you is a bonus action. When you cast the spell from this cloak, you do not concentrate on it, the spell simply takes effect and remains in effect for it’s full duration. If you die while the spell is active, the spell ends.

entries.name: Master of The Skies
entries: You can speak with any beast, monstrosity, or elemental that has an innate flying  speed, even if it does not share a language with you. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks against creatures with an innate flying speed. You can also cast {@spell command} and {@spell dominate monster} (DC 19) on said creatures at will and they have disadvantage on their saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Sky Magic
entries: You are granted a unique control over air, allowing you to cast the following spells without requiring material components or expending a spell slot (Spell Save DC 19, +11 to hit) : {@spell blustering winds|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (at will), {@spell gust of wind} (at will), {@spell warding wind|XGE} (at will), {@spell wind wall} (at will) {@spell control winds|XGE} (at will), {@spell cyclone|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (3/day), {@spell fly} 3/day), {@spell investiture of wind|XGE} (1/day), {@spell wind walk} (3/day), {@spell whirlwind|XGE} (1/day), {@spell suffocating sphere|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (1/day)

entries.name: Elemental Servants
entries: As an action, you can summon up to five {@creature air elemental|MM|air elementals} or one {@creature elder tempest|MTF} under your control. They obey your commands and regard you as a friend. Once you’ve used this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn. The elementals are destroyed when they reach 0 hit points, or when you use this feature again.

item.name: Belt of The Ancient Lands
entries: This impossibly heavy belt can make the entire world quake in fear. Ancient primordials fear the champions of the past that sought and claimed this legendary belt.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest.

entries.name: Gaia's Champion
entries: You have a climb and burrow speed of 80 feet and you can burrow through solid stone at half your burrow speed. You ignore difficult terrain created by earth, stone, debris, and you can walk on quicksand as if it were ordinary ground. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks and to damage from elementals originating from the elemental plane of earth.

entries.name: Earth Shaper
entries: As an action you can cast {@spell stone shape} at will without expending a spell slot or requiring material components.

entries.name: Master of The Lands
entries: You can speak with any beast, monstrosity, or elemental that has an innate climb or burrow speed, even if it does not share a language with you. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks against creatures with an innate climb or burrow speed. You can also cast {@spell command} and {@spell dominate monster} (DC 19) on said creatures at will and they have disadvantage on their saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Earth Magic
entries: You are granted a unique control over air, allowing you to cast the following spells without requiring material components or expending a spell slot (Spell Save DC 19, +11 to hit) : {@spell rock slide|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (at will), {@spell earth tremor|XGE} (at will), {@spell boulder bash|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (at will), {@spell earthbind|XGE} (at will) {@spell maximilian's earthen grasp|XGE} (at will), {@spell erupting earth|XGE} (3/day), {@spell wall of stone} 3/day), {@spell investiture of stone|XGE} (1/day), {@spell bones of the earth|XGE} (3/day), {@spell move earth} (1/day), {@spell earthquake} (1/day), {@spell gaia's wrath|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (1/day)

entries.name: Elemental Servants
entries: As an action, you can summon up to five {@creature earth elemental|MM|earth elementals} or one {@creature zaratan|MTF} under your control. They obey your commands and regard you as a friend. Once you’ve used this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn. The elementals are destroyed when they reach 0 hit points, or when you use this feature again.

item.name: Sceptor of Chaos
entries: In between the elemental planes, there are the border elements and then there is the elemental chaos. Among the chaos, this single staff floats in a random place. This scepter is a conduit for combining the other four artifacts for the elemental planes. It binds them together, much like how the other elemental planes are connected through the elemental chaos.

The staff has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. You have a +1 bonus to your spell attack and spell save DC. For every two artifacts listed in Part of a Whole and Destroying the Set, other than the scepter, that you are also attuned with, both of the bonuses increase by 1.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest. The first time you attune to this item a piece of your humanity is lost. You gain two indefinite madnesses, which cannot be cured by any means. Neither magic nor divine intervention can reverse these effects.

entries.name: Chaos Magic
entries: The staff has 10 charges. For every artifact listed in Part of a Whole and Destroying the Set, other than the scepter, that you are also attuned with, the staff gains another 10 charges. By expending one or more of the staff’s charges, you can cast the following spells as an action without expending a spell slot or requiring material components using your spell save and spell attack bonuses: {@spell absorb elements|XGE} (1 charge), {@spell chaos bolt|XGE} (1 charge) {@spell magic missile} (1 charge), {@spell magnify gravity|EGW} (1 charge), {@spell cyclone|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (3 charges), {@spell erupting earth|XGE} (3 charges) {@spell fireball} (3 charges), {@spell pulse wave|EGW} (3 charges) {@spell tidal wave|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell prismatic spray} (7 charges), {@spell prismatic wall} (9 charges)

entries.name: Master of Chaos
entries: As a reaction, whenever you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can make that roll with advantage. You can choose to do so before or after you make the roll, potentially changing the result. In addition, you can cast plane shift at will, but you can only go to the elemental planes or the elemental chaos.

entries.name: Chaotic Burst
entries: While attuned to all of the items listed in, you may use an action to destroy the scepter and all of the other artifacts connected with this one. When you do so, you and every creature within 120 feet of you takes 10d6 acid, 10d6 cold, 10d6 fire, 10d6 lightning, 10d6 thunder, 10d6 poison, and 10d6 force damage. Every artifact destroyed in this way remains destroyed for 1d6 x 100 years, after which the artifacts reform themselves. Even a wish cannot alter the rate of which it reforms, nor can it reform the artifacts.

entries.name: Part of a Whole and Destroying the Set
entries: The Scepter of Chaos, {@item Amulet of The Bottomless Seas|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, {@item Belt of The Ancient Lands|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, {@item Cloak of The Boundless Skies|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, and the {@item Crown of Eternal Flames|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} are all pieces of one artifact. However, only the Scepter of Chaos can connect them. While attuned to the scepter, you can attune to the other pieces of the whole and it doesn’t count toward your total number of used attunement slots.

When you are attuned to all of the listed items above, you have resistance to all damage. Each of the items cannot be destroyed by any means, unless the scepter is united with all of the artifacts and the creature attuned to the scepter uses its action to destroy all of the artifacts.

item.name: Celestia Brand Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo is brightly colored, usually coming in bright gold.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Touch of Life
entries: As an action, you touch yourself or another creature, they magically regain 3d10 hit points and are given a magical ward that protects them from death. If the warded creature would fall to 0 hit points or die, they are instead reduced to 1 hit point. Once you’ve used this property, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Lightbringer
entries: As a bonus action, you can cause your tattoo to glow brightly, shedding bright light out to a range of 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet. As a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can reduce both the bright and dim light down to a minimum range of 5 feet, or stop the tattoo from glowing, or extend the range back to a maximum range of 30 feet for both the dim and bright light. While fiends and undead are within the radius of the tattoo’s bright light, they have disadvantage on attack rolls.

item.name: Flask of Replenishable Life
entries: A creature that drinks from this flask when filled with its glistening, golden liquid has their hit point maximum and current hit points increased by 30. These hit points can be divided among two or three creatures evenly. This benefit is lost when they finish a long rest.

Once a creature, or creatures, drinks from the flask, it refills on the next dawn. However, creatures that drink from the flask cannot do so again until seven days have passed since they drank from it.

Alternatively, the flask can be used as an action to bring a creature back to life, as per the Resurrection spell, without requiring material components. Once this property is used from the flask, it cannot be used again until the next dawn. Doing so empties the flask until the next dawn. You cannot use this property if the flask is empty.

item.name: Silver Flask of Restoration
entries: This ever-gleaming silver flask has special properties on the inside. Any water you pour into the flask becomes clean drinking water. This has no effect on harmful liquids, such as poisons or lava. The water in this flask is refreshing and has replenishing properties. When you drink from this magical flask, you regain 2d6 hit points.
Once a creature regains hit points from the flask, that creature cannot regain hit points from it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Phoenix Feather of Rebirth
entries: You can attach this fiery feather onto your clothes, armor, weapons, or shield. The next time you are reduced to 0 hit points or die, you are instead reduced to 1 hit point and fire erupts from you in a 30 foot-radius. Every creature in that radius makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. Afterwards, the feather burns up and is turned to ash.

item.name: Circlet of The Lifebringer
entries: This gold and silver laced circlet has a single crystal embedded in the front of it. This circlet was crafted with the conjoined effort of the finest elven, dwarven, and human crafters known at the time of its creation with the additional aid of Eldath, Goddess of Peace. The circlet was originally intended for Eldath’s chosen champion to uphold the peace throughout the land.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The artifact allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest.

entries.name: Life Bringer
entries: When you use a spell or magical effect to heal a creature, the crystal glows with brilliance. The healed creature regains an additional amount of hit points equal to your level.

entries.name: Healing Touch
entries: As an action or bonus action, you may touch a creature and have them magically regain 2d8 hit points. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses at the next dawn.

entries.name: Peaceful Magic
entries: The circlet has 20 charges. You can expend 1 or more charges to cast the following spells from the circlet without requiring material components, using your spellcasting ability modifier. If you do not have spellcasting, you choose between Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma to use as your spellcasting ability for these spells: {@spell cure wounds} (1 charge per spell level, up to 5th), {@spell healing word} (1 charge per spell level, up to 5th), {@spell calm emotions} (2 charges), {@spell lesser restoration} (2 charges), {@spell mass healing word} (3 charges), {@spell mass cure wounds} (5 charges), {@spell greater restoration} (5 charges), {@spell heal} (6 charges). The circlet regains 1d6 + 4 charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Angelic Form
entries: While attuned to this item, you are transformed into a heavenly, idealized version of yourself, blessed with otherworldly beauty and a touch of heaven in your heart. If you have evil in your heart, you must make a DC 20 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, your alignment becomes neutral good and you attain the previously mentioned Angelic Form. If you succeed, you retain your alignment and instead you take the form of a fallen angel, your brightness becomes shroud in darkness and shadows. You gain the following traits:

items.name: Angelic Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Celestial.

items.name: Celestial Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic and radiant damage.

items.name: Feathered Wings
entries: You sprout a beautiful pair of feathered wings that grant you a flying speed of 60 feet and the ability to hover. If you already have a different kind of wings, these new wings replace the old ones, which fall off.

items.name: Truesight
entries: Your eyes become luminous pools of silver.
