You can see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic, and see into the Ethereal Plane, all within a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Destroying the Circlet
entries: In order to destroy the circlet, you must bathe it in the negative energy plane for 1 year and use a properly worded wish to destroy the circlet. When destroyed, Eldath will immediately know it has been destroyed and will have a permanent scar on her forehead. The scar can be removed if a new circlet is made.

item.name: Shield of The Brightwood
item.reqAttune: by a bard, cleric, druid, or paladin
entries: This shield was handcrafted by a Deva that grew too close to the Aasimar it was guiding and chose to remain on the material plane, protecting its envoy. While it cannot use its abilities directly, it chose to put some of its power into this shield.

This wooden shield has a sun painted in the center of it that shimmers with a mystical glow, shedding dim light out to a range of 5 feet. You can use a bonus action to stop the shield from glowing, or have it glow again.When you heal a creature while wielding this magical shield, you and the creature healed gains temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier.

While holding this shield, it creates an aura in a 10-foot radius around you. You and all creatures friendly to you in the aura have a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws and any critical hit against them becomes a normal hit. If you have 17 or more levels in the cleric or paladin class, the radius of the aura increases to 30 feet.

If another creature within this would take damage while you are holding this shield, you can use your reaction to take the damage instead, protecting the creature from any additional effects that would follow and is instead transferred to you.

The shield has 10 charges. While holding this shield, you can spend one or more of its charges to cast the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier: {@spell healing word} (1 charge per spell level, up to 4th), {@spell sanctuary} (1 charge), {@spell shield of faith} (1 charge), {@spell shielding vitality|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (1 charge per spell level, up to 4th), {@spell mass healing word} (3 charges), {@spell death ward} (4 charges), {@spell ward of vitality|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting} (4 charges).

Every time you spend charges from this shield, you regain 1d6 hit points for every charge spent. Any healing that would exceed your maximum hit points is instead treated as temporary hit points instead of being excluded from the roll.
The shield regains 1d6 + 4 charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Pan Flute of Summoning
entries: This magic instrument typically comes with a song sheet written in common. A creature attuned with this item can summon the song sheet by performing a 10 minute ritual. A creature attuned to this pan flute can play a song from it and summon a magical creature. As an action you can cast the {@spell Summon Beast|TCE} spell from this pan flute. Its spell attack modifier is 5 for the purposes of this summoning.
Once you've summoned a creature using this pan flute, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Maracas of Summoning
entries: This magic instrument typically comes with a song sheet written in sylvan. A creature attuned with this item can summon the song sheet by performing a 10 minute ritual. A creature attuned to these maracas can play a song from it and summon a magical creature. As an action you can cast the {@spell Summon Fey|TCE} spell from these maracas. Its spell attack modifier is 6 for the purposes of this summoning.
Once you've summoned a creature using these maracas, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bagpipes of Summoning
entries: This magic instrument typically comes with a song sheet written in deep speech. A creature attuned with this item can summon the song sheet by performing a 10 minute ritual. This sounding instrument can be used to play a song to summon a magical creature. As an action you can cast the {@spell Summon Aberration|TCE} spell from these bagpipes. Its spell attack modifier is 6 for the purposes of this summoning.
Once you've summoned a creature using these bagpipes, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Lyre of Summoning
entries: This magic instrument typically comes with a song sheet written in celestial. A creature attuned with this item can summon the song sheet by performing a 10 minute ritual. This elegantly crafted lyre can be used to play a song to summon a beautiful magical creature. As an action you can cast the {@spell Summon Celestial|TCE} spell from this lyre. Its spell attack modifier is 7 for the purposes of this summoning.
Once you've summoned a creature using this lyre, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Flute of Dragon Summoning
entries: This magic instrument typically comes with a song sheet written in draconic. A creature attuned with this item can summon the song sheet by performing a 10 minute ritual. This roughly crafted flute can be used to play a song to summon a majestic magical creature. As an action you can cast the {@spell Summon Draconic Spirit|FTD} spell from this flute. Its spell attack modifier is 7 for the purposes of this summoning.
Once you've summoned a creature using this flute, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Box of Magical Makeup
entries: This small box contains a kit that allows you to apply magical cosmetics to yourself, typically in the form of makeup. You can use this box to cast the {@spell disguise self} spell with a spell save DC of 13. If you are proficient with a disguise kit, you may add your proficiency bonus to the DC. You may cast disguise self in this way using the box once, regaining the ability to do so again on the next dawn.

You can also use this to create cosmetics that can store spells. By spending materials worth 50 gp per level of the spell, you can produce enough makeup of your choice that is imbued with the spell, allowing you to cast it once without expending a spell slot. The chosen spell must be one that you know, have prepared, or have a spell scroll of and cannot require costly components to cast. Storing the spell in the makeup does not consume the spell scroll. The save DC and spell attack bonuses are equal to the spellcaster’s or the scroll the spell came from.

If asked nicely, the box can also produce non-magical cosmetics, requiring no pre-existing materials or cost. It takes 10 minutes to create up to 50 gp worth of cosmetics. They disappear 24 hours after creation, or you can dispel the cosmetics as a bonus action at any time beforehand.

itemGroup.name: Robe of Elemental Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to one type of damage while you wear these elemental robes. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly from the options below.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.
items: Robe of Acidic Defense|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting
Robe of Icy Defense|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting
Robe of Fiery Defense|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting
Robe of Shocking Defense|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting
Robe of Toxic Defense|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting
Robe of Thunderous Defense|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting

trait.name: Ice Glide
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked frozen ice and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Numbing Cold
entries: When the elemental deals cold damage to a creature, they must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by 10 feet and they have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of the elemental's next turn.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The elemental can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Ice Pillars {@recharge 5}
entries: Pillars of ice sprout from the ground in a 30-foot-cone from the elemental. Each creature within range makes a {@dc 16} dexterity saving throw or takes {@damage 2d8 + 5} piercing damage and {@damage 2d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The pillars of ice then immediately shatters and retracts back into the ground.

Ice Elementals are born where the Plane of Water meets and freezes against the Plane of Air.  They have little need to interact with humanoids, but react poorly to those carrying fire or otherwise threatening their frigid privacy.  In your campaign they might also be the result of magical experiments (the forced merging of air and water elementals) or servants of the powers of cold and winter.

Icebergs from the Plane of Water can spill out into the Plane of Air.  (This is one source of many planar white dragons’ lairs.)  Provided the currents keep the icebergs cold and close to the Plane of Water, the ice elementals that dwell there are not disturbed.  But should their bergs drift too far or begin to melt, these ice elementals can become desperate to return home—and mortal adventurers’ airships are a too-rare and too-tempting target to ignore.

Elementals are incarnations of the elements that make up the universe: air, earth, fire, and water. Though little more than animated energy on their own planes of existence, they can be called on by spellcasters and powerful beings to take shape and perform tasks.

entries.name: Living Elements
entries: On its home plane, an elemental is a bodiless life force. Its dim consciousness manifests as a physical shape only when focused by the power of magic. A wild spirit of elemental force has no desire except to course through the element of its native plane. Like beasts of the Material Plane, these elemental spirits have no society or culture, and little sense of being.

entries.name: Conjured by Magic
entries: Certain spells and magic items can conjure an elemental, summoning it from the Inner Planes to the Material Plane. Elementals instinctively resent being pulled from their native planes and bound into service. A creature that summons an elemental must assert force of will to control it.

entries.name: Bound and Shaped
entries: Powerful magic can bind an elemental spirit into a material template that defines a specific use and function. Invisible stalkers are air elementals bound to a specific form, in the same way that water elementals can be shaped into water weirds.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: An elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

monster.name: Frostbiting Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Numbing Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the zombie must make a {@dc 14} constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Frozen Body
entries: The zombie adds its constitution modifier to its AC.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes two Frost Bite attacks.

action.name: Frost Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage and the creature's movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the zombie's next turn. The creature can only incur this penalty to a creature once a turn per different creature it hits.

variant.name: Frostbreathing Zombies
entries: Some frostbiting zombies have uniquely adapted lungs, allowing them to exhale a powerful breath of cold energy. A frostbreathing zombie has the following additional action option:

entries.name: Frost Breath (Recharge 6)
entries: The zombie exhales a powerful breath of cold energy. Each creature within a 15 cone must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this damage is frozen in ice and {@condition petrified} until it has been revived or the frozen statue takes 30 points of fire damage.

Creatures that die within the frozen wastes and tundras sometimes becomes undead. Most often they take the form of ghosts or specters due to the harsh environment, however some bodies gain unique properties and adapt to the climate, making them a uniquely more powerful zombie.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The frost demon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14, +6 to hit with spells). The frost demon can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The frost demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The frost demon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The frost demon can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The frost demon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the frost demon dies, it explodes in a burst of cold energy. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 32 ({@damage 8d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fiend makes two attacks with its Ice Pike.

action.name: Ice Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage.

Deep in the abyss lies demons with a particular affinity to arctic environments. Their tribes are often freezing cold, far colder than anywhere else in the deep abyss. Sometimes, Frost Demons leave the abyss and make their tribes in arctic environments.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cryomancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Empowered Cold Elementalist
entries: The cryomancer deals an additional 4 points of cold damage whenever they deal cold damage. (Included in actions)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cryomancer makes two attacks using Freezing Bolt, it's Ice Staff, or any combination of the two. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Ice Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) cold damage.

action.name: Freezing Bolt
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) cold damage and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet.

action.name: Breath of Winter {@recharge 4}
entries: The cryomancer releases out a 60-foot cone of cold energy. Each creature in the are must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 44 {@damage 10d8 + 4} cold damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. Creatures who fail the save by 5 or more have their movement speed reduced to 0.

bonus.name: Winding Staff
entries: As a bonus action, if the cryomancer made at least one attack with its Ice Staff with its multiattack, it can immediately make one additional attack with its Ice Staff.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the cryomancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

Cryomancers are evokers who have mastered the art of cold magic. Their specialties lie in restricting other creatures' movements and freezing their enemies solid. They tend to be calm and collected, but also frightening when they need to be. It's often best not to make one a foe.

hp.special: 5 + five times your dragon warrior level (the ally has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to your dragon warrior level)

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The draconic ally doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Shared Traits
entries: The draconic ally shares any immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities its summoner has. It also uses its summoner's proficiency bonus rather than its own.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + PB}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The construct does not need to eat, drink, sleep, or breath nor can it be put to sleep.

trait.name: Improvised Expert
entries: The construct is an expert at using its surroundings to its advantage. It adds your proficiency bonus to all improvised attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2 + PB}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Magitech Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 2 + PB} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4 + 2 + PB}) force damage.

bonus.name: Shove
entries: The construct can take the {@action shove} action as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Fix, Fix, Fix! (1/Day)
entries: The constructed uses magic to self repair itself. It regains {@dice 1d4 + PB} hit points.

hp.special: 5 + five times your dragon warrior level (the ally has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to your dragon warrior level)

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The draconic ally doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Shared Traits
entries: The draconic ally shares any immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities its summoner has. It also uses its summoner's proficiency bonus rather than its own.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The winged draconic ally doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + PB}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Beat Wings
entries: As a bonus action, the dragon can beat its wings to attempt to knock down a creature within reach using powerful gust of winds. If the creature is Large or smaller, it must make a {@dc 8 + PB + 3} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Warding Wing
entries: When a creature targets the draconic ally or a creature it can see within 10 feet of it with a ranged weapon attack, the draconic ally can use its reaction to give that attack disadvantage.

hp.special: 5 + five times your dragon warrior level (the ally has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to your dragon warrior level)

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The draconic ally doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Shared Traits
entries: The draconic ally shares any immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities its summoner has. It also uses its summoner's proficiency bonus rather than its own.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The drake draconic ally has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the drake draconic ally's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + PB}) piercing damage.

action.name: Frightening Gaze
entries: The drake draconic ally stares down a creature and attempts to frighten it. It chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is aware of it, it needs to make a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 8} + PB + 3. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of the drake's next turn.

bonus.name: Draconic Infusion
entries: As a bonus action, the drake draconic ally can infuse its next attack with its draconic energy. It deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of the type from your Draconic Origin feature.

reaction.name: Protective Ally
entries: When you or one of your allies is targeted for an attack by a creature within reach of the drake draconic ally, it can make a bite attack against that creature.

hp.special: 5 + five times your dragon warrior level (the ally has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to your dragon warrior level)

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The draconic ally doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Shared Traits
entries: The draconic ally shares any immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities its summoner has. It also uses its summoner's proficiency bonus rather than its own.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sea serpent draconic ally can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + PB}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 + PB} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + PB}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 + PB} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + PB}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 8} + PB + 3). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the sea serpent draconic ally can't constrict another target.

bonus.name: Tail Strike
entries: As a bonus action, the sea serpent draconic ally can make a tail attack.

reaction.name: Tail Parry
entries: If you or an ally is targeted for a melee weapon attack and are within 10 feet of the sea serpent draconic ally, it can swipe its tail and add a bonus to the target's AC equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the astral stalker is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the astral stalker instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The astral stalker deals an extra 20 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Swift Hunter
entries: The astral stalker can take the Dash or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Elusive Prey
entries: Creatures have disadvantge on ability checks made to track the stalker.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The astral stalker makes two claw attacks. The astral stalker can replace one of its attacks with its claw with a throat dart.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Throat Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/150 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage.
The creature looks like a muscular humanoid with thick black-green skin. Its demonic visage is reminiscent of a skeletal human with a prominent jaw. Its hands end in large, wickedly sharp claws.

Astral stalkers roam the multiverse looking for the ultimate quarry. They live for the thrill of the hunt, and they measure their personal worth and status in their community by the number and power of the creatures that they have successfully hunted.

These able hunters prefer to stalk intelligent foes, and the pleasure they gain from hunting these creatures for sport makes them evil by the standards of any race. However, astral stalkers adhere to a short list of tenets that they refer to as the Rules of the Hunt: Once its quarry has knowingly eluded an astral stalker, it will never again hunt that creature; if hired to hunt a creature, the stalker will not hunt its employer for at least one year; and no astral stalker will ever hunt another astral stalker.
Astral stalkers find that their prey provides better sport if it knows it is being hunted, so they often warn their quarry in some roundabout fashion before beginning the hunt.
An astral stalker typically stands 6 feet tall and weighs 275 pounds.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The glaistig's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). She can innately cast the following spells:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The glaistig can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Water Symbiosis
entries: Each glaistig is mystically bound to a body of water or a waterway as small as a pond or as large as a lake or river. A glaistig cannot move more than 600 feet away from its body of water and still breathe normally. If a glaistig strays farther away, it must hold its breath or immediately start to suffocate. If the glaistig is summoned by a spell, or conjured by a spell such as {@spell Conjure Fey}, it can breath normally for the duration of the spell, after which it immediately begins to suffocate if it is not returned to its home plane. Once a glaistig has moved beyond the boundary of its connection, it cannot breathe normally until it has immersed itself in its body of water.

trait.name: Blood Drain
entries: If the glaistig is grappling a creature, whenever it deals damage to the {@condition grappled} target using its bite; it regains hit points equal to the damage dealt and that creature's maximum hit points is reduced by the same amount. If a creature's maximum hit points are reduced to zero by this feature, it dies. A creature's hit point maximum reduced by this feature is restored to normal when it finishes a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Glaistig makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Beguiling Song
entries: A glaistig can attempt to beguile creatures with its song. A glaistig sings, targeting a single creature it can see within 100 ft. Of the body of water to which it is linked (see Water Symbiosis, above). A creature is immune to the Beguiling Song if it is {@condition deafened}, {@condition unconscious}, or cannot hear the song. The targeted creature must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the Glaistig. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way spends their turn taking the most direct path to the Glaistig and spends its action worshiping the Glaistig's beauty. An affected creature repeats its save at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on a success. A creature who succeeds on the glaistig's beguiling song is immune to its effects for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Glaistig Mindbender
entries: Naturally inclined toward magic and enchantments of all kinds, many glaistigs become sorcerers that specialize in mind-bending magic. They use these abilities to enhance their chances of luring prey to their watery homes. The following spells are added to the Glaistig's At Will innate spellcasting: {@spell charm person}, {@spell disguise self}, {@spell mage armor}, and {@spell hold person}. This variant of glaistig loses its multiattack.
{@i A staggeringly beautiful maiden stands waist-deep in the water, swaying back and forth as she sings a haunting song.}

Beautiful and enchanting, glaistigs are fey that lurk in and around pools, lakes, and streams. They have an insatiable craving for the blood of mortals, beguiling victims to come close to their lair in order to drain them. They are commonly mistaken for vampires because of their bloodsucking technique, but they are not undead.

Glaistigs resemble incredibly attractive female humans or half-elves, but instead of normal legs, they have goat legs with long, white fur. Most have snow-white hair and eyes that shimmer like water. When they smile, glaistigs try not to show their teeth, which are sharpened to cruel-looking fangs and revealed only when they are about to strike. Glaistigs wear long, fine robes and dresses that drape along the ground, which are used to hide their legs. Glaistigs loathe showing their legs to anyone, and will only reveal them to lash out in anger. If someone catches sight of a glaistig’s goat legs, it will become very angered and attack the offender.

Despite their single-minded lust for blood, glaistigs are unpredictable and capricious. If they have recently fed (say, within a month) then they are just as likely to help someone as they are to attack. More than a few people have been attacked by a glaistig, even if it has talked and been friendly to them in the past. Glaistigs also enjoy dancing, and some lure their victims to caper and dance for many hours before attacking them.

Glaistigs are solitary by nature and do not even like other fey all that much. While they gain no sustenance from the blood of sylvan creatures, glaistigs have been known to attack fey that come too close into their territory. Perhaps because of their similar nature, glaistigs in particular do not like dryads, and it is extremely rare to find the two beings in the same territory.
An average glaistig is about 5 feet 2 in height and weighs about 90 pounds.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fate weaver can cast the following spells using Charisma as its spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spells):

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fate weaver has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Blessing of Fate
entries: The AC of the fate weaver includes its Charisma bonus.

action.name: Guiding Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and the next attack roll made against the creature has advantage.

action.name: Boon of Fate (4/Day)
entries: The fate weaver can choose a creature within 15 ft of it. For one hour, that creature can roll an additional {@dice d20} whenever it makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and choose the result they take. Once they do so, they lose the ability to do so unless they are given another Boon of Fate.

action.name: Mending Weaving {@recharge 5}
entries: The fate weaver touches a creature. They regain {@dice 4d8 + 4} hit points.

bonus.name: Healing Weave {@recharge 4}
entries: The fate weaver can choose a creature within 60 feet of them, the chosen creature regains {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points.

bonus.name: Spell Weaving (4/Day)
entries: The fate weaver can regain the use of one of their spells by spending the use of a different spell.

reaction.name: Fate Weaving (5/Day)
entries: As a reaction, the Fate Weaver can add a {@dice d6} from to any ability check, attack roll, or saving throw from a creature it can see within 30 ft of it. Alternatively, they can subtract a {@dice d6} from any attack roll it can see within 30 ft of it.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the fate weaver protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

Fate weavers are not just like any other wizard who can draw power from the weave, or a cleric who receives their power from a divine entity. Fate weavers are more akin to sorcerers in that their magic stems directly from the weave itself, but on an even greater scale. Fate weavers are often the children of the weave and their magic is as raw as it comes. Mystra, the goddess of magic, alongside The Raven Queen, the goddess of death and fate, are like 'god mothers' to these children of the weave.

Despite their direct connection to the weave, many fate weavers have trouble learning magic outside of healing, divination, and abjuration magic. Not impossible, but difficult - especially with evocation magic outside of healing. Some of the most deadly spells are outside the reach of most fate weavers, but they do gain access to the most powerful spell any mortal can cast if they make it to that point.

Fate weavers toy with the designs of most gods, including that of Mystra and The Raven Queen. Often, they relish the challenge of such a thing. Playing with fate, testing their luck against the worst odds imagineable.

spellcasting.name: Blood Magic Spellcasting
headerEntries: The desire demon has innate blood magic, its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to hit with spells). The desire demon can cast the following spells without requiring material components:

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has {@condition charmed}. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the desire demon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The desire demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Desirable Charm
entries: One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the fiend's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend's Charm for the next 24 hours.
The fiend can have only three targets {@condition charmed} at a time. If it charms another past that limit, the effect on the previous target ends.

action.name: Draining Kiss
entries: The fiend kisses a creature {@condition charmed} by it or a willing creature. The target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 50 ({@damage 8d10 + 6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Possession {@recharge 5}
entries: One humanoid that the fiend can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the fiend; the fiend then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The fiend now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The fiend can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect,  and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, Telepathic Bond, Desirable Charm, Draining Kiss, and its Innate Blood Magic. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the fiend ends it as a bonus action, or the fiend is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the fiend reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this fiend's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

reaction.name: Hellish Rebuke
entries: The desire demon can cast {@spell hellish rebuke} when it takes damage by a creature within range of the spell.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The desire demon moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Blood Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The desire demon casts one of its at will blood magic spells with a casting time of one action or bonus action.

legendary.name: Possession (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The desire demon uses its Possession feature, provided it is available.

Of all the threats from beyond the Veil, few are more insidious and deceptively deadly than the desire demon. Far more intelligent than the bestial hunger and rage demons, more ambitious than the demons of sloth, these spirits are among the most skilled at tempting mages into possession.

Desire demons use the yearnings of the victims—lust, wealth, power—to their advantage. Their abilities to affect the mind allow them to assume disguises and even alter the environment to their purposes. As a result, many who become their prey never realize it. While desire demons may resort to an outright mind control, they seem to take greater pleasure in more subtle deceit.
If overpowered, a desire demon will most likely attempt to bargain its way to freedom. These deals usually end with the demon gaining an upper hand, even when the mage believes otherwise.

spellcasting.name: Innate Blood Magic
headerEntries: The witch's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}, {@hit 17} to hit with spell attacks). The witch can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Blood Witch Dance
entries: The witch can use a bonus action to control the movement of one creature cursed by its hex spell that it can see within 30 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 25} Charisma saving throw or use its reaction to move up to 30 feet in a direction of the witch's choice.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the witch's darkvision.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Morgana can't be affected or detected by spells of 3rd level or lower unless she wishes to be. She has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If Morgana fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: Morgana has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Morgana regains 30 hit points at the start of her turn.

trait.name: Discorperation
entries: When Morgana drops to 0 hit points or dies, her body is destroyed but her essence travels back to her domain in the Abyss, and she is unable to take physical form for a time.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The witch makes four attacks: three with a weapon and one using one of her at will spells with a casting time of one action.

action.name: Eldritch Blast (4 beams)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 17} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 9}) force damage.

action.name: Blood Witch Riteknife
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/40 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d4 + 8}) piercing damage in melee, or 10 ({@damage 1d4 + 8}) piercing damage at range, plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: Morgana teleports up to an unoccupied space within range of her fly speed.

legendary.name: Blood Magic
entries: Morgana casts one of her At will Innate Blood Magic spells.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Morgana teleports up to an unoccupied space within range of her fly speed.

Morgana was once a human who had a fascination with the supernatural and the unknown. She tried to study magic, but at the time the art of magic was not as common and as such, only those gifted could actually wield the magic. Morgana was not one of these special few.

Fortunately for her, there were other ways to obtain magic. Though, these practices were forbidden and had consequences beyond what you could possibly imagine. Morgana knew the risk, but cared not for it, as such, she began the forbidden rituals to summon a Demon from the Abyss.

A demon of desire, one of the many creations of Graz'zt, answered her demonic calling. It was at that moment Morgana knew just the kind of deal she needed to make to achieve her dream. However, Morgana was far more cunning than anyone could have guessed. The contract they formed was easily far more in favor for Morgana, and the consequences of said contract were near irrelevant to her.

When Morgana obtained her magical gift, she knew time was short, and sought to master it as quickly as she could. With many sleepless nights passing, she eventually grew more powerful than  even the demon who gave it to her. Once she was that powerful, only the demon lords could frighten her.

monster.name: Blood Mage
languages: and any one other language of its choice

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The blood mage can cast the following spells using Charisma as their spellcasting ability (spell save DC: 16, +8 to hit with spells):

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: The AC of the blood mage includes its Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the blood mage's darkvision.

trait.name: Life Drinker
entries: When the blood mage uses its mulitattack and hits a creature using its Life Drain, it gains 5 temporary hit points for each one that hit.

trait.name: Sanguine Sense
entries: While the blood mage isn't {@condition blinded}, it can see any creature that isn't an Undead or a Construct within 60 feet of itself, even through total cover, heavily obscured areas, invisibility, or any other phenomena that would prevent sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blood mage makes two attacks with its Blood Lash. It can replace any one of these attacks with a use of its spellcasting.

action.name: Blood Lash
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the blood mage's next turn.

action.name: Blood Boil {@recharge 4}
entries: The blood mage chooses a point within 150 feet of itself, and a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point fills with a burst of searing, blood-red mist. Each creature of the blood mage's choice that it can see in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Sacrificial Attacks {@recharge 4}
entries: The blood mage can spend 10 hit points to gain advantage on all of its attacks until the end of the current turn.

reaction.name: Blood Bolster
entries: The blood mage can bolster its abilities using its own vitality as a sacrifice. By spending 10 hit points when it fails an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, it can reroll the {@dice d20}, choosing the higher result.

Blood Mages often study powerful and unspeakable types of magic, performing rituals on their own bodies to improve their endurance and practicing spells far less ethical for standard mages. They focus a lot on destructive, necromantic, and enchantment based magic.

trait.name: Blood Enhancement
entries: The blood demon's weapon attacks add an additional 2d6 necrotic damage (included in attack). In addition, whenever the blood demon rolls an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw and it would fail, it can use a reaction to add {@dice 2d6} to the roll potentially turning the failure to a success. The blood demon then takes damage equal to what it rolled.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The blood demon regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The blood demon has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Aura of Blood Lust
entries: When any other creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the blood demon, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, or it must immediately take the Attack action, making one melee attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, it makes a ranged attack against a random creature within range, throwing its weapon if necessary.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The blood demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blood demon makes two attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Blood Enhancement
entries: Whenever the blood demon rolls an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw and it would fail, it can use a reaction to add {@dice 2d6} to the roll potentially turning the failure to a success. The blood demon then takes damage equal to what it rolled.

Blood Demons are the spawn of powerful fiendish creatures with magical prowess, often the Demon Princes of the Abyss. They have an unrivaled bloodlust and seeks only to kill and destroy. They can be offspring of demons, or a creature can be possessed by demons to become a blood demon themselves.

entries.name: Demonic Nature
entries: Blood Demons are incapable of having natural born offspring. Those that wish to propagate must find other ways to do so, almost always involving magic. Blood Demons are practically immortal in terms of age. However, their lifespan is ultimately determined by the nature of the ritual performed to become a blood demon.
Blood Demons inherit personality traits common to their fiendish heritage, so a blood demon made from Graz'zt, Demon Prince of Lustful Desires, would be very lustful as one would expect.

entries.name: Blood Demon Template
entries: A beast, humanoid, giant, or monstrosity can become a blood demon. When a creature becomes a blood demon, it retains all its statistics except as noted below.

entries.name: Challenge
entries: Use the guidelines in the Dungeon Master's Guide to recalculate the rating after you apply the template.

entries.name: Senses
entries: The blood demon gains {@sense darkvision} with a radius of 60 feet.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: Its creature type is changed from its original to fiend.

entries.name: Immunities and Resistances
entries: The blood demon gains immunity to poison and necrotic damage and resistance to fire, cold, and lightning damage. It also gains immunity to being diseased and poisoned.

entries.name: Languages
entries: The blood demon speaks Abyssal in addition to any other languages it knows.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: The blood demon's AC is equal to 13 + its Constitution modifier, unless its AC was already higher.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The blood demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: New Ability: Blood Enhancement
entries: The blood demon's weapon attacks add an additional 2d6 necrotic damage. In addition, whenever the blood demon rolls an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw and it would fail, it can use a reaction to add {@dice 2d6} to the roll potentially turning the failure to a success. The blood demon then takes damage equal to what it rolled.

entries.name: New Ability: Blood Frenzy
entries: The blood demon has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: New Ability: Aura of Blood Lust
entries: When any other creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the blood demon, that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it must immediately take the Attack action, making one melee attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, it makes a ranged attack against a random creature within range, throwing its weapon if necessary. The DC equals 8 + proficiency bonus + Charisma modifier.

entries.name: New Ability: Regeneration
entries: The blood demon regains hit points equal to its CR at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Player Characters as Blood Demons
entries: A player character who becomes a blood demon may do so for many reasons. A desire for power, a means to an end, or maybe they were captured by other blood demons and transformed into one. For whatever reason a player character may consider becoming a blood demon, the following applies for any that become one:

items: The character's alignment changes to be any evil alignment if it wasn't already.
The character gains all the changes mentioned above in the Blood Demon Template.

The GM has the option to take control over the player's character for any duration of time, however circumstances can lead to the player's character regaining their senses. In addition, the player rolls on the Indefinite Madness table and applies the random flaw to the character. This madness goes away only if the character is returned back to normal, which can only be done via a properly worded Wish.

hp.special: 30 (Slain) or 20 (Cursed or Betrayed only) + 10 for each spell level above 3rd

trait.name: Rage of Vengeance (Slain Only)
entries: The spirit adds {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage to its Vengeful Strikes and it has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

trait.name: Blood Lusting Aura (Betrayed Only)
entries: Any creature, other than you, that starts its turn within 5 feet of the spirit must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or attack a random creature within range of its attacks other than you or the spirit. It uses the weapon in its hands or an unarmed strike. It throws the weapon if necessary.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Vengeful Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} necrotic damage, and the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

action.name: Gaze of Despair (Betrayed Only)
entries: The spirit chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the start of your next turn.

action.name: Soul Strike (Cursed Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} force damage, and the creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn.

bonus.name: Curse of Vengeance (Cursed Only)
entries: The spirit curses a creature it sees within 60 feet of it. While cursed, when it takes damage it takes an additional amount of necrotic damage equal to {@damage  summonSpellLevel}. A {@spell Remove Curse} can end this effect and the effect ends early if the creature is reduced to 0 hit points or dies. Only one creature can be cursed at a time from this spirit.

monster.name: Erikku Blade

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Erikku can cast the following spells using Wisdom as his spellcasting ability, without requiring material components (save {@dc 21}, +13 to hit):

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: Erikku Blade ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause him to be {@condition restrained}. he can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Magic can't put Erikku Blade to sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Erikku fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Erikku has and is attuned to (if applicable) to the following items: {@item The Blade of The Neverending Storm, Ragnarok|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, {@item Wraps of The Stormbringer|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, {@item Bracers of Defense|DMG}

trait.name: Perfect Body
entries: Erikku is immune to disease and cannot be aged magically.

trait.name: Stunning Strike {@recharge 4}
entries: When he hits with an attack, Erikku can make that attack a stunning strike. The target makes a Constitution saving throw {@dc 21} or is {@condition stunned} until the end of Erikku's next turn.

trait.name: A Hero's Last Stand (Legendary Trait, Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When Erikku would be reduced to 0 hit points, his current hit point total instead resets to 200, all of his actions and bonus actions recharges, and he regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance and Spellcasting. Additionally, he gains access to his Legendary Actions options below for the next hour. After he uses this trait, for the next hour he emits a violent aura of lightning. His AC increases by 3 and each of his attacks deals an additional {@damage 2d10} lightning damage. Finally, for this hour he ignores immunity to lightning damage once on each of his turns.

trait.name: Storm Adept
entries: Erikku ignores a creature's resistance to lightning and thunder damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Erikku has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Erikku makes four attacks, two with Ragnarok and two Unarmed Strikes or Tempest Strikes. He can replace any one of these attacks with a use of his Spellcasting.

action.name: Wrath of the Lightning Fist (Only when Legendary Trait is active, {@recharge}
entries: Erikku makes eight attacks, four with Ragnarok, and four using either his Unarmed Strikes or his Tempest Strikes.

action.name: Ragnarok
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Tempest Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) lightning damage

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bolt of Lightning {@recharge 5}
entries: Erikku creates a bolt of lightning and releases it outward in a 100-foot-long 5-foot-wide line originating from him. Each creature in its area must make a Dexterity saving throw {@dc 21} or take {@damage 10d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

action.name: Nature's Remedy {@recharge}
entries: Erikku draws upon nature's power to cure a creature's wounds. He either heals himself or a creature within 5 feet of him {@dice 6d8 + 6} hit points. This healing also cures any poisons or diseases.

bonus.name: Patient Defense {@recharge 4}
entries: Erikku can take the dodge action as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Step of The Tempest {@recharge 5}
entries: Erikku can take the dash action as a bonus action, and his movement speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the current turn.

bonus.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: Erikku can make two attacks using his Unarmed Strikes as a bonus action. He can replace any one of those attacks with a Tempest Strike.

bonus.name: Nature's Mending {@recharge 4}
entries: Erikku chooses a creature he can see within 60 feet of him. That target regains {@dice 6d4 + 6} hit points.

reaction.name: Reactive Strike
entries: Erikku can use his reaction to make an attack using an Unarmed Strike or a Tempest Strike when he is targeted for an attack by a creature within reach.

reaction.name: Reactive Dodge
entries: Erikku can avoid incoming attacks, adding a +6 bonus to his AC for the triggering attack.

legendaryHeader: If Erikku's Legendary Trait has activated, for the next hour he can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. He regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Flurry of The Tempest
entries: Erikku makes two attacks using his Tempest Strikes.

legendary.name: Step of The Wind
entries: Erikku moves up to his fly speed. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Summon Lightning (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Erikku can instantly recharge his Bolt of Lightning or an expended use of his {@spell Call Lightning} spell.

legendary.name: Fury of The Lightning Fist (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Erikku makes six attacks using his Tempest Strikes.

{@i "Life is precious, no matter where it comes from. Those who have it should always have a chance to make the most of it. Those who choose to use that life to take  from others doesn't deserve that right."}

Erikku Blade is a well-renowned hero among the world of Torrin, legends are told of his achievements from defeating the powerful Acererak, who was once known as The Forgotten One, founding the once fallen but now prospering town of New Edam, protecting the world from the threats of the creatures from the great beyond, and much more.

He even aided in defeating the old lesser God of War, Selvetarm, who was revered as the Champion deity of Lolth. This allowed the ascension of the new God of War, Kord. Erikku was originally meant to be the one to ascend, however he passed on the opportunity to Kord as he saw him more fitting for the role than he.

Erikku is a kind, gentle soul who seeks to protect those who cannot protect themselves. However, his gentleness is tempered with the will to do what is necessary in order to protect those around him. He will not hold back against someone who uses awesome power to destroy others. He is always willing to give a second chance, however. Usually allowing most of his foes an opportunity of redemption. Most do not take this opportunity, but those that have became powerful allies to Erikku and are now some of many protectors of Torrin.

Erikku had a rough childhood, going most of it orphaned. His sister, Memori, is all he had left of his family for the longest time. And even then they were separated for a good amount of their lives. However, Erikku's deeds would go to have the queen of the elves, Lia Elvenwood, to be in his debt. Using her last wish, she returned Erikku's parents to him, who now live with him in his retirement in the Town of New Edam.

Erikku bares the unique ability to control and manipulate lightning. He is said to inherit this ability passed on from his family lineage called "The Lightning Fist". He honed this ability using his training as a monk in a monastery and furthered delved into magic by attuning to his mother's roots as a druid. He is an excellent combination between being a trained warrior, to being a compassionate healer. A perfect combination of his parents.

fly.condition: (120 ft. when Awaken The Phoenix is used)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Divine has an innate connection to the weave, allowing her to cast the following spells through it using Charisma as her spellcasting ability and without requiring material components (spell save {@dc 22}, +15 to hit with spells):

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: Divine senses magic within 120 feet of her at will. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Divine has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Divine has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Divine fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Divine makes three attacks using her Fiery Strikes. She can also replace any one of her attacks with a use of her spellcasting.

action.name: Fiery Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) fire damage damage.

action.name: Fiery Explosion {@recharge 4}
entries: Divine creates a magical explosion of fire centered on a point he can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 47 ({@damage 14d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Awaken The Phoenix (3/Day)
entries: Divine harnesses her innate power and unleashes it in a violent fiery aura. For the next minute, she gains the following benefits:
{@b Fiery Aura.} Every other creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of Divine takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage.
{@b Potent Flames.} Whenever Divine deals fire damage, she adds an amount equal to her Charisma modifier.

{@b Fiery Form.} Divine can occupy a creature's space and end her turn there. Moving through creatures does not count as difficult terrain for her, and when she is hit by a melee attack she deals {@damage 2d6} fire damage to attacker.

bonus.name: Patient Defense {@recharge 4}
entries: Divine can take the dodge action as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Quickened Spell {@recharge}
entries: Divine can expend a use of one of her spells with a casting time of one action using a bonus action instead.

bonus.name: Healing Flames {@recharge 5}
entries: Divine chooses one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. That creature regains {@dice 7d4 + 7} hit points.

reaction.name: Flames of Rebirth (3/Day)
entries: If Divine would be reduced to 0 hit points, she can use her reaction to instead have her hit points reset to 50 and flames explode outward in a 30-foot-radius. Every creature she chooses in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. If she used her Awaken The Phoenix ability is active, it immediately ends and the damage dealt is instead {@dice 12d6}.

monster.name: Memori Blade
languages: Sylvan; and she understands all languages.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Memori can cast the following spells without requiring material components using Charisma as her spellcasting ability (spell save DC: 21, +13 to hit with spells):

trait.name: Action Surge (1/Rest)
entries: Memori can take one additional action this turn.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Memori has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Silver Tongue
entries: When Memori rolls for a Persuasion or Deception check, she can treat the roll on the {@dice d20} as a 10.

trait.name: Jack of All Trades
entries: Memori adds half her proficiency bonus to ability checks she does not already add her proficiency bonus to.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Memori fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Battle Master (6/Rest)
entries: Memori is an expert in combat, thus she can use the following battle maneuvers from the Battle Master Fighter: {@optfeature Commanding Presence|TCE}, {@optfeature Rally}, {@optfeature Menacing Attack}, {@optfeature Tactical Assessment|TCE}, {@optfeature Bait and Switch|TCE}.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Memori has and is attuned to (if applicable) to the following items: {@item Adventurer's Studded Leather Armor of Glamour|theadventuresoftorincampaignsetting}, {@item Fannigan's Fancy Folding Kitchen|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, {@item Bracers of Archery|DMG}, {@item Memori's Memento|TheAdventuresofTorinCampaignSetting}, {@item +2 Rapier|DMG}, {@item Cape of the Mountebank|DMG}, {@item Instrument of the Bards, Cli Lyre|DMG}, {@item Quiver of Ehlonna|DMG}, {@item Bottle of Boundless Coffee|SCC}, {@item Emerald Pen|FTD}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Memori makes three attacks using her Memori's Memento, her +2 Rapier, or any combination of the two. She can replace any one of her attacks with a use of her spellcasting.

action.name: Memori's Memento
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 17} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d8 + 11}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: +2 Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Bardic Inspiration (7/Rest)
entries: Memori can choose one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. For the next minute, that creature can add a bonus {@dice 1d10} to their next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The bardic inspiration is only lost if the check was successful.

bonus.name: Second Wind (1/Rest)
entries: Memori regains 15 hit points.

bonus.name: Unsettling Words
entries: Memori can expend one use of her Bardic Inspirations and choose a creature within 60 feet of her that she can see. She rolls the die and subtracts that number from the creature's next saving throw until the start of her next turn.

monster.name: Starlight Companion

hp.special: PB + 2 times your Fate Weaver level

languages: and the languages of its creator

trait.name: Companion's Bond
entries: The Starlight Companion cannot be {@condition charmed} by creatures other than its summoner. The Starlight Companion gets another use of its Starlight Wish per day when its summoner reaches 6th and 10th levels.

trait.name: Companion's Tether
entries: The Starlight Companion can be no further than 60 ft away from its summoner, or it begins to lose hit points. It loses 5 hit points if it starts its turn more than 60 ft away from its summoner. If it is reduced to 0 hit points in this manner, it is destroyed. While the Starlight Companion is within 30 ft of its summoner, both the summoner and the companion regains 1 hit point, so long as one of them has half of their remaining hit points or less. Whenever a spell or magical effect that lasts longer than one round is cast on its Summoner, the Starlight Companion shares the same magical effect.

action.name: Bless (1/rest)
entries: The Starlight Companion casts {@spell bless} as a 1st level spell. Its summoner becomes an automatic target of the spell, and the other two targets must be creatures friendly to its summoner. Once this spell is cast in this way, it cannot be cast again until its summoner completes a short or long rest even if a new Starlight Companion is summoned.

action.name: Starlight Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) radiant damage.

action.name: Starlight Wish (1/Day)
entries: The Starlight Companion asks you or a creature friendly to you what they desire. It will do its best to accomplish this wish, whatever that may be. Choose one of the following effects to grant: that creature receives healing equal your fate weaver level plus your proficiency bonus; that creature removes one disease or poison afflicting it; that creature gains the benefit of the help action for 1 minute; that creature can teleport once up to 30 ft as a bonus action for the next minute, losing the ability to do so afterwards; that creature's speed is doubled for the next minute.

Anything beyond what is mentioned above is beyond what the starlight companion can grant. If a creature wished for an effect that lasts longer than one round, the effect is lost if the starlight companion is destroyed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pyromancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Empowered Fire Elementalist
entries: The pyromancer deals an additional 4 points of fire damage whenever they deal fire damage. (Included in actions)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pyromancer makes two attacks using Fiery Bolt. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Fiery Bolt
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Explosion {@recharge 4}
entries: The pyromancer creates a magical explosion of fire centered on a point they can see within 120 feet of him. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 39 ({@damage 10d6 + 4}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the pyromancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

reaction.name: Rebuking Flames (3/Day)
entries: When the pyromancer takes damage from a creature within 30 feet of them, they can force that creature to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10 + 4} fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The acidmancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15, +7 to hit with spells}):

trait.name: Empowered Acid Elementalist
entries: The acidmancer deals an additional 4 points of acid damage whenever they deal acid damage. (Included in actions)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The acidmancer makes two attacks using Mote of Acid. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Mote of Acid
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) acid damage.

action.name: Acid Rain {@recharge 4}
entries: The acidmancer creates a magical green cloud hovering over a point they choose within 120 feet. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius and 30-foot tall cylinder centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 12d4 + 4}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the acidmancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aeromancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks}):

trait.name: Empowered Storm Elementalist
entries: The aeromancer deals an additional 4 points of lightning or thunder damage whenever they deal lightning or thunder damage. (Included in actions)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aeromancer makes two attacks using Storm Strike. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Storm Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) lightning or thunder damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike {@recharge 4}
entries: The aeromancer produces a storm cloud which calls forth a lightning bolt from the sky. They choose a creature they can see within 100 feet of them, that creature and every creature within 5ft of it must make a Dexterity saving throw {@dc 15} or take {@damage 3d10 + 4} lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. The storm cloud then disperses.

bonus.name: Blast of Wind
entries: Wind builds up and rushes outward in a 30 foot long 10 foot wide line from the aeromancer. Every creature within the line must make a Strength saving throw {@dc 15} or be pushed 10 feet away from the line.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the aeromancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

reaction.name: Storm's Fury
entries: When the aeromancer is hit by a melee attack, they can deal lightning {@damage 2d6 + 4} lightning or thunder damage to the attacker and they must make a Strength saving throw {@dc 15} or they are pushed 20 feet away from them.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aquamancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Aquamancer can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aquamancer makes two attacks using Watery Whip. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Watery Whip
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Giant Wave {@recharge 4}
entries: The aquamancer creates a magical tidal wave that instantly rushes outward in a 10-foot-tall, 10-foot-wide, and 30-foot-long line. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed 20 feet and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success and is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Refreshing Healing (3/Day)
entries: The aquamancer can use its bonus action to touch a creature and heal it with magical healing water. The creature regains {@dice 3d8 + 3} hit points and the aquamancer can choose one condition or disease the creature is suffering, if any, and end it.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the pyromancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The geomancer can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The geomancer makes two attacks using Earthen Slam. They can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Earthen Slam
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Gaia's Shaking Earth {@recharge 4}
entries: The geomancer magically shakes the earth beneath him, causing a quake in a 60-foot-radius. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, taking 30 ({@damage 6d10}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Gaia's Grace (3/Day)
entries: The geomancer can use its bonus action to choose a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target magically regains {@dice 3d4 + 3} hit points and any poisons or diseases are ended.

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
entries: When they are hit by an attack, the pyromancer protects themselves with an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force. Until the end of their next turn, they gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The herbalist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}), +6 to hit with spells:

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The Herbalist has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The herbalist makes one Thorny Whip attack and one  Quarterstaff attack. They can replace one of these attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 ‒1}) bludgeoning damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d8 ‒1}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Nature's Staff (only when active)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Thorny Whip
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage. Rather than doing damage, on hit if the creature is large or smaller it can instead be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Mending Touch {@recharge 5}
entries: The herbalist touches a creature with magical energy. The creature magically restores {@dice 3d8 + 3} hit points.

bonus.name: Nature's Staff
entries: The herbalist can use a bonus action to empower their quarterstaff with magic for 1 minute. For the duration, they use their Nature's Staff instead of their Quarterstaff for attacks.

bonus.name: Healing Remedy {@recharge 4}
entries: The herbalist crushes a magical remedy and blows a healing vapor to a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The chosen creature magically restores {@dice 3d4 + 3} hit points.

Herbalists are magic users who focus creating potions and basic remedies to accommodate for ailments, illnesses, and mending basic wounds. Occasionally, they use their skills for profit, whereas others do so as a form of charity.

trait.name: Constructed Body
entries: Due to its magically constructed nature, the body of the Extraplanar Ally is not the same as the summoned creature. As a result, it cannot gain the benefits of healing and it may not retain the ordinary attributes, resistances, or special senses a creature of the chosen variety might have. When the Extraplanar Ally is reduced to 0 hit points, the body bursts into harmless flames and is destroyed.

The constructed body can take any appearance, so long as it is similar enough to the chosen creature type. Typically, you'd want to make a body that best befits the chosen creature and to accommodate for its typical attacks and abilities.
The Extraplanar Ally uses your proficiency bonus in place of its own.

trait.name: Specialized Expertise
entries: Choose two skill proficiencies for the Extraplanar Ally to have. The Extraplanar Ally adds double your proficiency bonus to any ability checks using the chosen skills.

trait.name: Specialized Attributes
entries: For its attack and damage rolls, it uses either Strength or Dexterity. The ability scores chosen for the Extraplanar Ally are interchangeable, but are defaultly set to the recommended areas. You choose two saving throws, the Extraplanar Ally adds your proficiency bonus to those chosen saves.

trait.name: Spellbound
