entries: Whenever you cast a spell, you can cast that spell originating from your Extraplanar Ally's position instead. If the spell has a range of self, it affects your Extraplanar Ally instead of yourself if you cast it from your Extraplanar Ally's position.

spellcasting.name: Psionic Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Extraplanar Ally uses intelligence for its Psionic spellcasting (spell save DC equals 8 + PB + its intelligence modifier, and its spell attack is PB + its intelligence modifier.) and it has the following psionic spells:

trait.name: Constructed Body
entries: Due to its magically constructed nature, the body of the Extraplanar Ally is not the same as the summoned creature. As a result, it cannot gain the benefits of healing and it may not retain the ordinary attributes, resistances, or special senses a creature of the chosen variety might have. When the Extraplanar Ally is reduced to 0 hit points, the body bursts into harmless flames and is destroyed.

The constructed body can take any appearance, so long as it is similar enough to the chosen creature type. Typically, you'd want to make a body that best befits the chosen creature and to accommodate for its typical attacks and abilities.
The Extraplanar Ally uses your proficiency bonus in place of its own.

trait.name: Specialized Expertise
entries: Choose two skill proficiencies for the Extraplanar Ally to have. The Extraplanar Ally adds double your proficiency bonus to any ability checks using the chosen skills.

trait.name: Specialized Attributes
entries: For its attack and damage rolls, it uses either Strength or Dexterity. The ability scores chosen for the Extraplanar Ally are interchangeable, but are defaultly set to the recommended areas. You choose two saving throws, the Extraplanar Ally adds your proficiency bonus to those chosen saves.

trait.name: Spellbound
entries: Whenever you cast a spell, you can cast that spell originating from your Extraplanar Ally's position instead. If the spell has a range of self, it affects your Extraplanar Ally instead of yourself if you cast it from your Extraplanar Ally's position.

trait.name: Variable Trait
entries: Choose one of the following benefits for the Extraplanar Ally to have (at level 10 you pick two benefits), if a variable trait allows the ally to cast a spell, it uses your spell attack modifier and spell save DC:

{@b Improved Psionic Spellcasting} - The Extraplanar Ally adds {@spell eldritch blast} and {@spell vicious mockery} to its at will cantrips and the following spells to its 1/day spells for it's Psionic Spellcasting trait, it can use either its own spellcasting ability or yours for these spells: {@spell shield} and {@spell command}

{@b Eldritch Horror} - The Extraplanar Ally has a horrific appearance that strikes fear into creatures from the mere sight of it. Each creature other than you that starts its turn within 60 feet of the Extraplanar Ally makes a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} of the Extraplanar Ally. If it succeeds, it is immune to its Eldritch Horror trait for 24 hours. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats its saves at the end of each of its turns.

{@b Mind Blast} - The Extraplanar Ally can magically emit psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on an intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC or take a number of {@damage d6} psychic damage equal to your proficiency bonus and is {@condition stunned} on a failed save, or half as much and is not {@condition stunned} on a success. Once it uses this feature, it must recharge before it can be used again. Roll a {@dice d6} at the start of each of your turns. On a 6, the ability is recharged.
{@b Mental Fortitude} - The Extraplanar Ally has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and magic can't put it to sleep
{@b Sense Magic} - The Extraplanar Ally senses magic within 30 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical.
{@b Sticky Crawly Appendages} - The Extraplanar Ally is always under the effects of the {@spell spider climb} spell and has advantage on ability checks made to grapple creatures.
{@b Tentacle Burst} - The Extraplanar Ally can cast the {@spell Arms of Hadar} a number of times per day equal to your proficiency bonus.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit PB + 3} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC equals 8 + PB + Strength Modifier.

reaction.name: Psychic Backlash
entries: If the Extraplanar Ally is attacked by a creature within 15 ft of it, it can deal a number of psychic damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

trait.name: Constructed Body
entries: Due to its magically constructed nature, the body of the Extraplanar Ally is not the same as the summoned creature. As a result, it cannot gain the benefits of healing and it may not retain the ordinary attributes, resistances, or special senses a creature of the chosen variety might have. When the Extraplanar Ally is reduced to 0 hit points, the body bursts into harmless flames and is destroyed.

The constructed body can take any appearance, so long as it is similar enough to the chosen creature type. Typically, you'd want to make a body that best befits the chosen creature and to accommodate for its typical attacks and abilities.
The Extraplanar Ally uses your proficiency bonus in place of its own.

trait.name: Specialized Expertise
entries: Choose two skill proficiencies for the Extraplanar Ally to have. The Extraplanar Ally adds double your proficiency bonus to any ability checks using the chosen skills.

trait.name: Specialized Attributes
entries: For its attack and damage rolls, it uses either Strength or Dexterity. The ability scores chosen for the Extraplanar Ally are interchangeable, but are defaultly set to the recommended areas. You choose two saving throws, the Extraplanar Ally adds your proficiency bonus to those chosen saves.

entries: Whenever you cast a spell, you can cast that spell originating from your Extraplanar Ally's position instead. If the spell has a range of self, it affects your Extraplanar Ally instead of yourself if you cast it from your Extraplanar Ally's position.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The extraplanar ally has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Variable Trait
entries: Choose one of the following benefits for the Extraplanar Ally to have (at level 10 you pick two benefits), if a variable trait allows the ally to cast a spell, it uses your spell attack modifier and spell save DC:
{@b Celestial Weapons} - The Extraplanar Ally's longsword is magical and it deals an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage on hit.
{@b Angelic Willpower} - The Extraplanar Ally has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
{@b Divine Sense} - The Extraplanar Ally can cast the spell {@spell detect evil and good} a number of times per day equal to your proficiency bonus.

{@b Divine Spellcasting} - The Extraplanar Ally knows the {@spell guidance} and {@spell sacred flame} cantrips and can cast them at will. In addition, it can cast {@spell bless} and {@spell sanctuary} each once per day.
{@b Angel Wings} - The Extraplanar Ally has a flying speed equal it its walking speed and can hover.
{@b Divine Awareness} - The Extraplanar Ally has advantage on ability checks made to determine a lie.
{@b Angelic Size} - Your Extraplanar Ally becomes large and its longsword deals {@dice 1d6} additional slashing damage on hit.

action.name: Healing Touch (PB/Day)
entries: The Extraplanar Ally touches another creature. The target magically regains 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit PB + 4} to hit, one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

trait.name: Constructed Body
entries: Due to its magically constructed nature, the body of the Extraplanar Ally is not the same as the summoned creature. As a result, it cannot gain the benefits of healing and it may not retain the ordinary attributes, resistances, or special senses a creature of the chosen variety might have. When the Extraplanar Ally is reduced to 0 hit points, the body bursts into harmless flames and is destroyed.

The constructed body can take any appearance, so long as it is similar enough to the chosen creature type. Typically, you'd want to make a body that best befits the chosen creature and to accommodate for its typical attacks and abilities.
The Extraplanar Ally uses your proficiency bonus in place of its own.

You choose two saving throws, the Extraplanar Ally adds your proficiency bonus to those chosen saves.

trait.name: Spellbound
entries: Whenever you cast a spell, you can cast that spell originating from your Extraplanar Ally's position instead. If the spell has a range of self, it affects your Extraplanar Ally instead of yourself if you cast it from your Extraplanar Ally's position.

trait.name: Variable Trait
entries: Choose one of the following benefits for the Extraplanar Ally to have (at level 10 you pick two benefits), if a variable trait allows the ally to cast a spell, it uses your spell attack modifier and spell save DC:
{@b Balance Corrector} The Extraplanar Ally ignores difficult terrain.
{@b Constructed Resilience} - The Extraplanar Ally is immune to disease and has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.

{@b Constructed Sword} The Extraplanar Ally has a specialized weapon specifically made for it. It has a sword that deals {@damage 1d10} slashing damage plus its strength or dexterity modifier. These weapons are counted as magical.
{@b Fireproof} - The Extraplanar Ally is immune to fire damage.

{@b Spell-Storing Component} - The Extraplanar Ally can store spells for you to use at a later time. You can store spells whose total levels equal your proficiency bonus by casting the spell while within 10 feet of your Extraplanar Ally. The spells remain stored even if the Extraplanar Ally is returned to its home plane, but you cannot cast them unless you are within 10 feet of your Extraplanar Ally.

{@b Spell Disrupting Forcefield} - The Extraplanar Ally emits a magical field of arcane energy that wards it from spells. The Extraplanar Ally takes half damage from spells and has advantage on saving throws against spells.
{@b Improved Motor Components} - The Extraplanar Ally's speed is increased by 10 feet.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit PB + 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Flaming Body (Fire)
entries: The Extraplanar Ally's slam attack deals fire damage instead of bludgeoning. The Extraplanar Ally is immune to fire damage.

trait.name: Amorphous Form (Air, Fire, and Water Only)
entries: The Extraplanar Ally can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Freeze (Water)
entries: If the extraplanar ally (elemental) takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Invisible in Water (Water)
entries: The water weird is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.

trait.name: Hardened Body (Earth)
entries: The extraplanar ally reduces damage it takes from bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit PB + 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The extraplanar ally has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the extraplanar ally to sleep.

trait.name: Variable Trait
entries: Choose one of the following benefits for the Extraplanar Ally to have (at level 10 you pick two benefits), if a variable trait allows the ally to cast a spell, it uses your spell attack modifier and spell save DC:
{@b Invisibility} - The extraplanar ally can use a bonus action to become {@condition invisible}. This invisibility ends if it attacks or if a spell is cast originating from it.

{@b Faerie Wings} - The extraplanar ally grows a set of fairy wings. It gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed. If it ends its turn while it is flying, it safely descends 60 feet and continues to fall at a rate of 60 feet per round.

{@b Fey Magic} - The Extraplanar Ally knows the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip and can cast it at will. In addition, it can cast the {@spell faerie fire} spell a number of times equal to your PB per day.

{@b Sneaky Trickster} - The Extraplanar Ally knows the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip and can cast it at will. In addition, it can cast the {@spell pass without trace} spell a number of times equal to your PB per day.

{@b Fey Antics} - The Extraplanar Ally knows the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip and can cast it at will. In addition, it can cast the {@spell faenatics|AdditionalFey} a number of times equal to your PB per day.
{@b Speak with Beasts and Plants} - The Extraplanar Ally can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language. You also gain this benefit while within 10 feet of the Extraplanar Ally.

{@b Mimicry} - The Extraplanar Ally can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check against your spell save DC.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The extraplanar ally has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Thorny Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit PB + 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Off-Hand Thorny Shortsword
entries: The Extraplanar Ally can engage in two-weapon fighting using its off-hand Thorny Shortsword, but it does not add its ability modifier to the damage.

monster.name: Extraplanar Ally (Fiend)
languages: Abyssal or Infernal; understands the languages you speak

As a result, it cannot gain the benefits of healing and it may not retain the ordinary attributes, resistances, or special senses a creature of the chosen variety might have. The constructed body can take any appearance, so long as it is similar enough to the chosen creature type. Typically, you'd want to make a body that best befits the chosen creature and to accommodate for its typical attacks and abilities.

entries: Choose one of the following benefits for the Extraplanar Ally to have (at level 10 you pick two benefits), if a variable trait allows the ally to cast a spell, it uses your spell attack modifier and spell save DC:
{@b Devil's Sight} - Magical darkness doesn't impede the extraplanar ally's darkvision.

{@b Death Throes} - When the Extraplanar ally is reduced to 0 hit points, before it is destroyed it explodes and releases outward a firey eruption out to a range of 30 feet. Each creature within range makes a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC and takes a number of {@damage d6} fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus on a failed save, or half as much on a succes.
{@b Freezing Stygia} - The extra damage from the Extraplanar Ally's Claws deals cold damage instead of fire and it gains resistance to cold damage.
{@b Winged Fiend} - The extraplanar ally gains a flying speed equal to 10 times your proficiency bonus.

{@b Flame Thrower} - The extraplanar ally gains special ranged attack. It makes a ranged spell attack with a range of 60 feet using your spell attack modifier. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage.
{@b Yugoloth Teleportation} - Immediately after the Extraplanar Ally hits with an attack, it can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

{@b Fiendish Charm} - The Extraplanar Ally can cast the {@spell charm person} spell a number of times a day equal to your proficiency bonus. If the target is successfully {@condition charmed} by the spell, the creature is {@condition charmed} by your Extraplanar Ally and you until the spell ends.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The extraplanar ally has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit PB + 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

As a result, it cannot gain the benefits of healing and it may not retain the ordinary attributes, resistances, or special senses a creature of the chosen variety might have. trait.name: Variable Trait
entries: Choose one of the following benefits for the Extraplanar Ally to have (at level 10 you pick two benefits), if a variable trait allows the ally to cast a spell, it uses your spell attack modifier and spell save DC:
{@b Winged} - it gains a flying speed of 40 ft.
{@b Aquatic} - it gains a swimming speed of 40 ft. and can breathe in both air and water.
{@b Spiked} - creatures that make melee weapon attacks against it while within 5ft of it takes piercing damage equal to PB.
{@b Siege Monster} - it always scores a critical hit on objects.
{@b Tough Body} - it has an additional number of maximum hit points equal to two times your PB.
{@b Durable Body} - it gains a bonus to its AC equal to its constitution modifier.
{@b Tail Attack} - it gains a tail attack, which it can use as a bonus action to make an additional attack when it takes the attack action.

action.name: Natural Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit PB + 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail (See Variable Trait)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit PB + 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Tail (See Variable Trait)
entries: After the extraplanar ally takes the attack action, it can immediately use its bonus action to make a tail attack.

walk.condition: (40 ft. when on ice or snow)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Fuyu can cast the following spells using Charisma as his spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 21}, +13 to hit):

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: Fuyu can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost him extra movement.

trait.name: Blade Runes
entries: Fuyu uses the following runes in combat, he can have three activated at the same time: Ise Rune, Haug Rune, Dragon's Might, Uvar. Each rune lasts for 1 minute, or 1 hour if it's effecting Fuyu.
{@i {@b Ise.}} The target's AC is increased by 7 and they can change the damage type of their weapons to cold.
{@i {@b Haug.}} The target has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
{@i {@b Dragon's Might.}} The target has advantage on strength ability checks, saving throws, and strength based attack rolls. In addition, their speed increases by 10 feet.

{@i {@b Uvar.}} The target can use their reaction to roll a {@dice d6} when the would be hit by an attack, reducing the attack roll by an amount equal to the number rolled and they can change the damage type of their weapons to lightning.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Fuyu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Fuyu wears a set of {@item frozen studded leather armor|theadventuresoftorincampaignsetting}, a {@item mantle of snow|theadventuresoftorincampaignsetting}, and is attuned to an exalted {@item winter's oath|theadventuresoftorincampaignsetting}, and has three spell scrolls of teleport, a {@item +1 shortsword|DMG}, a {@item bag of holding|DMG}, and always has at least one {@item white chromatic rose|WBtW}.

trait.name: Freezing Aura
entries: Every creature that Fuyu chooses when they start their turn within 10 feet of him makes a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 17}). On a failed save, they take {@damage 1d6} cold damage and gains one stack of {@condition exhaustion}, provided they don't already have one from this aura.
When a creature hits Fuyu with a melee attack while within 10 feet of him, they take {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Fuyu makes three attacks using his Freezing Ray, Winter's Oath, Frozen Rune Blade, or any combination of the three. He can replace one of his attacks with a use of his spellcasting.

action.name: Winter's Oath
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Freezing Ray
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) on hit and their speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of Fuyu's next turn.

action.name: Frozen Rune Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage and if the target is a creature, their movement is reduced by 10 feet until the start of Fuyu's next turn. He can only incur this penalty once per round per creature.

action.name: Cold Embrace {@recharge 4}
entries: Fuyu invokes an icy cold power from his Winter's Oath. He can choose one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. Unless they have resistance or immunity to cold damage, their body temperature immediately drops to -30 degrees fahrenheit. They make a {@dc 17} constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 10d6}) cold damage on a failed save or half as much on a success and suffer from the effects of extreme cold, gaining a level of {@condition exhaustion}. Their body temperature remains this way for 1 minute, or until Fuyu ends it early as a bonus action.

action.name: Breath of Winter {@recharge 5}
entries: Fuyu releases out a 60-foot cone of cold energy. Each creature in the are must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 12d8}) cold damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. Creatures who fail the save by 5 or more have their movement speed reduced to 0 until the start of his next turn.

action.name: Rune of Recovery {@recharge}
entries: Fuyu can touch a creature and magically heal them. The target regains 28 ({@dice 4d10 + 7}) hit points and is cured of any disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

bonus.name: Activate Rune
entries: As a bonus action Fuyu can activate one of his Blade Runes, giving its power to himself or a creature he can see within 60 feet of him.

bonus.name: Swift Strike
entries: Fuyu makes an attack using his Frozen Rune Blade.

bonus.name: Giant's Might (6/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Fuyu becomes a huge sized creature, provided he has the room to enlarge himself. Regardless if he grows or not, Fuyu adds a bonus {@dice 1d6} one of his melee attacks and has advantage on all Strength checks and saving throws.

reaction.name: Ice Shield (3/Day)
entries: Fuyu creates a magical arcane barrier made of ice. He adds a +5 bonus to his AC until the start of his next turn, including against the triggering attack.

spell.name: Winter’s Grasp
entries: Ice encrusts the ground radiating a powerful cold energy in a 15 foot radius, making it hard for creatures to maintain their balance. This icy ground is treated as difficult terrain. A creature that begins its turn in the affected area takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage and makes a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they fall {@condition prone}. At the end of their turns, they make a constitution saving throw. On a successful save, they become immune to the spell's effects.
The cold freezes nonmagical liquids in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Creeping Cold
entries: You choose a creature within range that you can see and mark them with a freezing cold brand. Ice begins to slowly creep from the ground beneath their feet to the tip of their head, covering the body with ice. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 6d6} cold damage and is {@condition restrained} as they are frozen to the ground. If the creature is airborne, a pillar of ice is made between the creature and the ground. The ice occupies the spaces in between it and the ground and the creature's elevation remains the same. The spell fails if the creature is more than 30 feet off the ground. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't affected. A creature is also unaffected by the spell if it has immunity to cold damage or being {@condition petrified} and a creature with resistance to cold damage has advantage on its saves against the spell.

A creature affected by the spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, it takes an additional {@damage 2d6} cold damage or half as much on a success. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned to a frozen statue and subjected to the {@condition petrified} condition for the duration. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.

A creature may use its action to break off a piece of the ice. Doing so counts as one successful save for the purposes of the spell. Every time the creature takes any amount of piercing or fire damage counts as one successful save.

spell.name: Cold Snap
entries: You snap your fingers and a burst of cold energy cracks at a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage and their movement is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one and their speed is not reduced.
The cold vapors spread around corners. It freezes non-magical objects and liquid in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Yeti's Chilling Gaze
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} cold damage and is {@condition paralyzed} for the duration, unless the target is resistant or immune to cold damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target. If a creature passes their save against this spell, they are immune to its effects for 1 hour.

spell.name: Glacial Grip
entries: You release a magical hand made of freezing cold ice toward a creature you can see. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the hand grasps onto the target and it takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use a bonus action to deal {@damage 1d8} cold damage to the target automatically, except the turn you cast the spell. Each time the target takes damage from the spell, its speed is reduced by 10 feet. The creature makes a constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shielding Vitality

time.condition: which you take when you or a creature within range would take damage

entries: You can prevent harm from coming to you or your allies. As a reaction when you or a friendly creature who doesn't have all of its hit points would take damage within range, you can reduce the damage that creature would take by {@damage 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ward of Vitality

components.m: a trinket or holy symbol made of gold or silver worth 500 gp

entries: For the duration, up to eight willing creatures gain 20 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost. While they have these temporary hit points, they have advantage on Constitution and Wisdom saving throws and their hit point maximum cannot be reduced.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the temporary hit points gained is increased by 10 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Divine's Fiery Chains
entries: You launch outward a chain of fire that wraps around a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three additional chains then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the chains.

A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage and is {@condition restrained} on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not {@condition restrained} on a success.

A {@condition restrained} creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of its turns and can use its action to attempt to break out of the chains by making a successful Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check against your spell save DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional chain leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Divine's Flames of Life or Death
entries: A wave of fiery energy washes out from a point centered on yourself. Choose either life or death. You can expend one of your Hit Dice and make three rolls using the size of the chosen Hit Die. You take damage equal to the total number rolled as burns envelop your body and your constitution is used to fuel the spell. You then apply one of the following effects depending on what you chose:

{@b Death.} Every other creature in that area needs to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking fire damage equal to the total number rolled plus your spellcasting ability modifier on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
{@b Life.} Every other creature you choose in that area regains hit points equal to the total number rolled plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the number of dice rolled increases by one for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Blustering Winds
entries: You extend your hands and gales of wind blows around you in a 10 foot radius centered on you. Creatures within range make a strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet back and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, they take half damage and suffers no additional effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Whelm

components.m: A vile filled with water from a waterfall

entries: You conjure an overwhelming amount of water that crashes onto a creature you can see within range with crushing force. That creature must make a Strength saving throw, or fall {@condition prone} and are {@condition restrained}. A flying creature is forced to the ground, but only takes half the normal amount of fall damage they would have received. At the start of each of the target's turns it takes {@dice 1d10} points of bludgeoning damage. At the end of the creature's turns it can repeat its saving throw, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Rock Slide
entries: You conjure a series of falling rocks at a point you can see within range in a 15-foot tall, 15-foot-long, and 5-foot-wide line. Every creature in the line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much on a success and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Water Whack
entries: Water wraps around your hand and you wave it at a creature, slamming it into them. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they pushed back 5 feet and are knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cutting Wind
entries: Magical winds build up in your hands and launch out to a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and are left scarred with magic. Until the start of your next turn, the next weapon attack that hits the target deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of the weapon's type.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the attack's damage increases by {@damage 1d6} ({@dice 2d6}). Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@dice 3d6} and {@dice 2d6}) and the attack again increases by {@dice 1d6} at 17th level ({@dice 4d6} and {@dice 2d6}).

spell.name: Water Splash
entries: Each creature in a 5-foot radius of a point you choose within range makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and are pushed 5 feet away from the center.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Burning Touch
entries: You ignite your hands with red hot flames and attempt to burn a creature. Make a melee spell attack, on hit it takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they are caught on fire and takes an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage at the start of each of their turns for the duration. A creature can use its action to put out the flames, or at the end of each of the affected creature's turn it can repeat its Constitution save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cyclone
entries: You summon a brief powerful windstorm to launch your enemies into the air. Choose a point within range, you summon a swirling windstorm in a 20-foot tall 20-foot radius cylinder. Every creature within the cylinder makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage and are pulled to the top of the cylinder toward the center, falling to the ground afterward. On a success they take half as much and are not pulled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Investiture of Water
entries: Until the spell ends, your body takes a watery appearance, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.
You have a swim speed of 60 feet and can breathe underwater as you do air.
You are always treated as if you were submerged underwater.

You can use your action to create a 10 foot long whip made of water. You can use a bonus action to attack with the whip. When you do, make a melee spell attack with a range of 10 feet. On hit, the water whip deals {@dice 2d4} plus your spellcasting ability modifier bludgeoning damage and the target makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they are knocked {@condition prone}.

You can use your action to control nearby water to snare your enemies. Choose a creature within 30 feet of a pool of water that is within 120 feet of you. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. You can use a bonus action to drag a creature {@condition restrained} in this way 10 feet closer to the pool. Once the creature is close enough, it can be dragged underneath the pool of water. A creature can use an action to repeat its Strength save, ending the {@condition restrained} effect on a success.

spell.name: Boulder Bash
entries: You conjure a giant rock and throw it in a 5-foot-wide 30-foot-long line. Each creature within range must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a success and is not knocked {@condition prone}. When the rock reaches the end of its range, or if it hits a wall, the rock vanishes. If it hits a wall, the wall automatically takes damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd

spell.name: Suffocating Sphere
entries: You attempt to draw the air out of a creature you can see within range. A creature is unaffected by the spell if it does not need to breathe. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature immediately starts to suffocate and begins choking. It can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round). After the previously mentioned rounds have passed, at the start of its next turn, it drops to 0 hit points and is dying, and it can't regain hit points or be stabilized until it can breathe again.

At the end of every round before it is reduced to 0 hit points, the creature can repeat its Constitution saving throw, ending the spell on a success. Once the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, you concentrate on the spell until the creature dies or until the duration ends.

spell.name: Weightless Form
entries: You become lighter than a feather. You and everything you are wearing and carrying become completely weightless, removing your tether from gravity. If you stop wearing or carrying an object, they regain their weight.

For the duration, you have a magical flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. In addition, you are immune to being {@condition prone} as you float back onto your feet at the cost of no movement and take no damage as a result from falling. Anytime you are hit by an attack, you are pushed back 10 feet away from the attacker.
If you are still flying when the spell ends, you safely descend at a rate of 60 feet per round until you touch the ground.

spell.name: Aquarius's Veil

m.text: A gilded gemstone worth 500 gp filled with ocean water

entries: You don yourself with a veil of watery armor. Until the spell ends, you have the following benefits:

items: You have immunity to fire damage and resistance to cold damage.
You have a swim speed of 80 feet and can breathe underwater as you do air.
While you're not wearing armor, your armor class becomes 14 + your Dexterity modifier and you have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

You have advantage on attack rolls made with daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears, or tridents and you can use your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls made with such weapons in place of Strength or Dexterity.
You gain 60 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

spell.name: Gaia's Transformation

m.text: A chunk of rare precious metal worth 1000 gp infused with magical moss, which the spell consumes

entries: You assume a magical form by mimicking the powers of Gaia. Your body becomes stone and moss forms randomly around your body. Choose either Guardian or Warrior. You gain the following benefits depending on what you chose when you cast the spell:

items: You are immune to poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons that are not adamantine. You have resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage regardless of the source.
You are immune to the {@condition poisoned} and {@condition petrified} conditions.
Your size becomes one size category larger. If you were gargantuan, you become twice as large. As a result, you deal twice as much damage with weapons against objects.
You have a burrow speed of 40 feet and can move through solid stone effortlessly, leaving the earth untampered with as you pass by.
You have a +2 bonus to AC (Guardian), or you have a +2 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws (Warrior).
All your weapon attacks are magical, and when you make a weapon attack, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
You gain 100 temporary hit points (Guardian) or you gain 50 temporary hit points (Warrior). If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

Your weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage (Warrior) or when you're not wearing armor, your AC becomes 20. You can still gain the benefits of a shield while under the effects of this spell (Guardian).

(Warrior) You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that lets you attack more than once when you take the Attack action on your turn; (Guardian) or you can use your action to form a protective barrier on any number of allies within 30 feet of you, protecting them from damage from one source reducing that damage to 0 (such as a weapon, spell, a dragon's breath weapon, etc.). This barrier lasts until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Poseidon's Wrath
entries: You conjure a wave of immeasurable force in a 500-foot-high, 500-foot-long, 100-foot-thick. Every creature and object in the area makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, every creature takes {@damage 12d10} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 12d10} cold damage and are knocked {@condition prone} and pushed to the end of the wave. Objects take twice the amount of damage and automatically fail the save. Creatures that save take only half damage and are pushed only half the distance they normally would be pushed and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

Magical and non-magical fire in the area is immediately extinguished and creatures who took the damage from this spell gains resistance to fire damage for the next minute. Spells that set creatures on fire and persist immediately end on affected creatures.
The area affected is not flooded, as the water dissipates after the spell takes effect.

spell.name: Flames of Avernus
entries: A wave of heat bursts out of your hands originating from the nine hells, incinerating creatures in a 120-foot cone of fire. Each creature within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 20d6} fire damage and are lit on fire for the duration. Creatures who failed take {@damage 5d6} fire damage at the start of each of their turns. As an action, a creature can attempt to put out the flames with a Dexterity ability check against your spell save DC. A creature that attempts this, pass or fail, takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage. On a success, the flames are put out and its effects no longer persist. On a fail, the flames and the spell persists.
On a successful save, the creatures take half the initial damage and are not lit on fire.
A creature who dies while under the effects of the spell has their body immediately turned to scorched ash, leaving behind only any magical items they had in their possession.

spell.name: Gale of The Primordials

components.m: a wing from a powerful creature, such as an angel or winged beast from the elemental plane of air

entries: A powerful wind builds up from your feet, granting you unmatched flight. You gain a flying speed of 150 feet for the duration. You take no damage as a result of falling and are immune to being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} as wind rushes from you, preventing anything from keeping hold of you.
Ranged attacks made against you have disadvantage and automatically miss if you are within their long range distance.

spell.name: Gaia's Wrath

components.m: a small chunk of a meteorite

entries: You conjure a large object made of stone which appears 200 feet above the point you choose. The stone can take any shape or appearance, so long as it is purely made of a form of earth. The object crashes directly onto the point you choose and creates. Each creature within a 60-foot radius makes a dexterity saving throw or takes {@damage 40d6} bludgeoning damage from the debris, or half as much on a success.
Objects in the area automatically take twice as much damage.
A 60-foot radius and 30-foot deep creator is left in the wake of the object, with the object completely destroyed and gravel fills the area, making it difficult terrain

spell.name: Static Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon crackles with electricity, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d10} lightning damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Chilling Smite
entries: The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon is freezing cold to the touch, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage. If the target is a creature, at the start of its next turn it must succeed a Constitution saving throw or have their movement speed cut in half until the spell ends. The creature may repeat its save at the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thunderstomp
entries: You stomp your foot or strike your weapon against the ground, creating a ripple of power that you can use to knock down your foes. Choose a creature within range, that creature must make a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone} and take {@damage 4d6} thunder damage, or half as much on a success and are not knocked {@condition prone}. You and the creature must be on the same solid surface, otherwise the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Lightning Whip
entries: You evoke an electrifying whip in your free hand. It is similar in size and shape to an actual whip, and it lasts for the duration. It has the light and reach properties. If you let go of the whip, it disappears, but you can evoke the whip again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the lightning whip. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d4} lightning damage and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw. On a fail, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.
In addition, you can use your bonus action to make a melee spell attack with the lightning whip, however it instead deals {@damage 1d4} lightning damage on hit instead of {@dice 3d4}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Slipstream

components.m: a few drops of oil and water

entries: You create a low-cresting wave of water that carries the target along the surface of water or the ground. The target's walking speed is increased by 20 feet until the spell ends. In addition, swimming does not cost the target any additional movement. If the target had a swim speed, it is increased by 30 feet until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Static Discharge
entries: Electric energy builds up within you and you release it outward in a powerful burst of energy. Each creature (except yourself) within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} lightning damage  and is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much on a success and is not {@condition stunned}.

Rather than using it's normal casting time, you can instead spend your entire turn building up energy and cast it immediately at the start of your next turn, taking up your action for your next turn. When you do so, creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw and you add two additional damage dice. In addition, the radius is increased by an additional 5 feet. See 'Longer Casting Times' on page 202 of the Player's Handbook for reference on casting a spell for longer than 1 action.
Charging the spell leaves you fatigued for a time. You gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ballad of Storms

components.m: a musical instrument worth at least 100 gp

entries: Your voice and song empowers a single creature that can hear you within range. The song is an intermingling of the elemental planes of air and water, syncing together in a perfect harmony. Until the spell ends, the target has a flying speed of 60 feet and can hover.

In addition, the target can empower their weapons and magic with the primordial energies of the elemental plane of air and the elemental plane of water. Whenever the target deals damage with a weapon or spell, they can deal an additional {@damage 2d8} lightning or thunder damage and creatures who take this damage are pushed up to 10 feet away from the attacker or source of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ballad of Fiery Earth

components.m: a musical instrument worth at least 100 gp

entries: Your voice and song empowers a single creature that can hear you within range. The song is an intermingling of the elemental planes of earth and fire, syncing together in a perfect harmony. Until the spell ends, the target is wreathed in magical flames that retaliate against creatures that hit them with melee attacks, dealing {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the attacker.

In addition, the target can empower their weapons and magic with the primordial energies of the elemental plane of earth and the elemental plane of fire. Whenever the target deals damage with a weapon or spell, they can deal an additional {@damage 2d8} fire or poison damage.
Also, whenever a creature under the effects of this spell heals a creature with a spell, they can add {@dice 1d8} healing to one of the rolls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ballad of Flowing Life

components.m: a musical instrument worth at least 100 gp

entries: Your voice and song empowers a single creature that can hear you within range. The song is an intermingling of the elemental planes of earth and water, syncing together in a perfect harmony. Until the spell ends, the target has a swim and climb speed of 60 feet and do not suffer penalties to their speed while traversing through difficult terrain.

In addition, the target can empower their ability to heal immensely by channeling both of the primordial energies of the elemental plane of earth and the elemental plane of water. Whenever they heal a creature with a spell, they can add an additional {@dice 2d8} healing to one of the rolls from the spell.
In addition, when they heal a creature with a spell, they can remove any one condition or disease, or they can remove one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Heart Sunder

components.m: a drop of blood from a humanoid

entries: You fill a creature you choose within range that you can see with necrotic energy. You cause their heart to beat rapidly and then stop momentarily. The creature makes a constitution saving throw taking {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much and is not {@condition stunned} on a success. Undead and Constructs automatically pass the saving throw of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 and the duration increases by 1 additional round for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Vile Mark
entries: You bestow a vile curse onto a creature you can see within range, making them more susceptible to damage for the duration of the spell. The affected creature is {@condition poisoned} and once every turn, whenever an affected creature takes damage, they take an additional {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage to one of the damage rolls of the source. A creature still suffers the damage even if they are immune to being {@condition poisoned}.
An affected creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the spell on a success. The spell can also be ended early with a {@spell Remove Curse}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d4 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Guise of The Blood Witch

components.m: a vile of humanoid blood engraved with arcane sigils worth at least 500 gp

entries: Uttering an incantation, you draw on the magic of the blood witch to transform yourself. You gain the following benefits until the spell ends:

items: You are immune to being {@condition charmed} and have advantage on saving throws against enchantment spells.
Whenever you take damage from a spell or effect originating from yourself, you can choose to not take damage once on each of your turns.
You have a magical flying speed of 30 feet and you can hover.
You gain 30 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

You can use a bonus action on each of your turns to turn your gaze to a creature you can see within 60 feet. That creature makes a wisdom saving throw or takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the spell ends. They take half damage and are not {@condition frightened} on a successful save.

spell.name: Summon Vengeful Spirit

m.text: humanoid blood inside a precious diamond worth at least 600 gp

entries: You call forth a vengeful spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Vengeance Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose Slain, Cursed, or Betrayed. The creature resembles a vengeful spirit of the chosen type, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Blade of Frost

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then ice begins to creep from the point of impact. The target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage to the target on a hit. The extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and again at 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

deity.name: The Traveling Merchant
entries: The Traveling Merchant is an unknown entity. Next to nothing is actually known of this being, except the fact that he is a very powerful traveler of the multiverse. Any following he has is purely occultic and is unlike any other religion. There are no known tennets and only rumored domains he has. Many claim him as the lord of mischief, while others call him an unmatched traveler.
What is known is that other gods fear this being more than any other.

default: (a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item component pouch|phb} or (b) an {@item arcane focus}
(a) a {@item priest's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Fate Weaver
entries: A cloaked woman with a deck of cards predicting your lover, a half-elf with glowing blue eyes dodging and dancing throughout the battle field effortlessly with uncanny foresight, and keeps her allies alive with the power of the moon's healing light.

A man with hair glowing brighter than a freshly lit torch, the aasimar empowers his allies with courage, strength, and the vigor they need to win the fight in their blight. And with his light, there shall be no monster to hide in the dead of night. May all evil fear their might.

At the dawn of day and the dusk of night, a tiefling mage travels with a hooded withered figure. By his side, risen from their last fight, a devil of unknown might at the beckon call of this mortal. Bound to his every desire, no matter how cruel.

Whatever aspect of fate they choose to walk with, fate weavers have a special tie to The Weave and the magic that comes from it. It is a large of part of their being, whether they know it or not. A fate weaver should never be alone though, do not mistake their special power to make them unstoppable. A fate weaver is the perfect person to have alongside you in a fight, but don't count on them to handle themselves on their own. When making a fate weaver, it's important to consider what your allies are capable of and try to aim for abilities that may improve where they're weak, or even empower what they already have. Work with your team, not for yourself.

entries.name: Connection to Magic
entries: Fate weavers are not just like any other wizard who can draw power from the weave, or a cleric who receives their power from a divine entity. Fate weavers are more akin to sorcerers in that their magic stems directly from the weave itself, but on an even greater scale. Fate weavers are often the children of the weave and their magic is as raw as it comes. Mystra, the goddess of magic, alongside The Raven Queen, the goddess of death and fate, are like 'god mothers' to these children of the weave.

Despite their direct connection to the weave, many fate weavers have trouble learning magic outside of healing, divination, and abjuration magic. Not impossible, but difficult - especially with evocation magic outside of healing. Some of the most deadly spells are outside the reach of most fate weavers, but they do gain access to the most powerful spell any mortal can cast if they make it to that point.

Fate weavers toy with the designs of most gods, including that of Mystra and The Raven Queen. Often, they relish the challenge of such a thing. Playing with fate, testing their luck against the worst odds imagineable.

entries.name: Origins and Introductions
entries: Fate weavers can come from almost any point of origin, as often times their unique abilities are a gift from the gods themselves. The weave has no favortism on whom receieves its boon.
Often though, their families are powerful mages as they draw forth the weave's power the most In doing so, their offspring becomes a sort of magnet for the weave, but not always.
It is also entirely possible for Mystra or The Raven Queen to choose specific individuals to be born with this power, or even obtain it later on in their travels.

It may be more fun to introduce your character as a traveling seer, or a fortune teller if you will, telling the fortunes of what's to come. Work with your DM on how you go about this, but also remember that keeping things simple is usually best for everyone.

entries.name: Creating a Fate Weaver
entries: As you make your Fate Weaver, think about how they came about their powers, whether it was by birth or some supernatural gift from a divine entity. Who taught you how to cast magic and why you chose to pursue it. You can base your character's personality on your chosen Aspect, or come up with something on your own.

Consider why you travel, are you seeking answers to a question you cannot find out through divination? Are you seeking a traveling party to aid and keep alive? Perhaps you thought it best to learn how to better yourself on a self-searching journey?
Fate Weavers are commonly of good or neutral alignments, but by nature alone the fate weaver can decide their own path.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a fate weaver quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Charisma your highest ability score, followed by your Wisdom. Second, choose the {@background sage} background. Third, choose the {@spell guidance}, {@spell prestidigitation}, and {@spell sacred flame} cantrips, along with {@spell mage armor}, {@spell shield}, {@spell healing word}, and {@spell guiding bolt} spells.

default: (a) any two {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} or (b) any {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}
(a) an {@item arcane focus|phb} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) {@item scale mail|phb} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) {@item leather armor|phb} and a {@item longbow|phb} with a {@item quiver} containing {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows}

entries: Born or inheriting draconic power, a dragon warrior is one who utilizes the ancient might of dragons and incorperates it into their everyday life. From defending themselves in combat, to using the various draconic magicks to make their day to day activities easier, to using their connection to their draconic blood to communicate with other dragons, a dragon warrior has plenty of versatility to play with.
fluff.name: Dragon Warrior

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Born with an innate ability to manipulate the weave and the magic that follows, you can cast spells and bend fate to your whim. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the {@filter fate weaver spell list|spells|class=fate weaver (FW)}. You learn an additional fate weaver cantrip of your choice at 4th level and another at 10th level.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Fate Weaver table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your fate weaver spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these fate weaver spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of fate weaver spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the {@filter fate weaver spell list|spells|class=Fate Weaver (FW)}. When you do so, choose a number of fate weaver spells equal to your Charisma modifier + your fate weaver level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level Fate Weaver, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Charisma of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of Fate Weaver spells requires time spent in prayer and medidation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your fate weaver spells, so you use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a fate weaver spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a Fate Weaver spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item Divination Focus|FW} (found above) as a spellcasting focus for your Fate Weaver spells.

classFeature.name: Aspect of Fate
entries: Each Fate Weaver chosen by the Goddess of Magic is granted a certain aspect that can change the course of battle. Each of the various Aspects of Fate are loosely inspired by tarot cards and the infamous {@item Deck of Many Things|dmg}.

classFeature.name: Fate Weaving
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you have the ability to bend fate around you. You have a pool of dice that you can use to grant you or your allies the ability to avoid danger. You have two fate dice, and gain an additional fate die as shown on the table for your level. Each fate die is a d4. You can use your reaction to spend one of these fate dice and use one of the following effects:

items: Choose a creature within 30 ft of you, that creature can roll the fate die and add the result to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw they made. This can be done before or after knowing the result, but before the outcome is determined.
When an enemy would hit you or a creature within 30ft of you with an attack roll, you can roll the fate die and subtract the result from the attack, potentially changing the outcome.

Choose a creature within 30 ft of you, that creature can roll the fate die and add the result as temporary hit points. These temporary hit points can stack with other instances of temporary hit points, but are always subtracted first.

entries: You regain spent fate dice after a long rest. At higher levels your fate dice increase in size, becoming a d6 at 5th level, a d8 at 10th, a d10 at 15th, and a d12 at 20th.

classFeature.name: Boon of Fate
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you gain the ability to change the fates of those around you. As an action on your turn by spending a 1st level spell slot you can give a willing creature within 15 ft of you a Boon of Fate for one hour. Whenever a creature with a Boon of Fate makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, they can spend their Boon of Fate to roll an additional d20 and choose the highest or lowest result of their choice.
When you gain higher level spell slots, you can expend those to give a number of creatures equal to the spell slot’s level a Boon of Fate. A creature can only have one Boon of Fate at a time.
You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses after a long rest.

classFeature.name: Divination Dice
entries: Starting at 5th level, you gain the ability to predict the future of events, or maybe even manipulate them in certain instances of time. Whenever you complete a long rest you roll two d6s and record the numbers rolled. You can then make these foretelling dice weal or woe dice. You can use these dice to modify the end result of an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw of a creature you can see, applying a negative modifier with woe dice or a positive modifier with weal dice. No action is required to use these dice, but you must choose to use them before the roll is made

Each foretelling roll can be used only once, and the maximum number of dice that can be weal or woe is equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down). When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.
When you reach 11th level the amount of dice you roll increases to three and at 17th level it increases to four.

classFeature.name: Spell Weaving
entries: Some were born with magic, some were born to have magic, some were born to master magic, the Fate Weaver was born with all of these traits. Starting at 3rd level, you gain the uncanny ability to manipulate the spell slots that you possess. As a bonus action, by expending a spell slot of 2nd level or higher you can convert that spell slot into a number of lower level spell slots equal to the spell slot’s level. You can distribute the spell slots as you wish.

Alternatively you can convert two spell slots of 8th level or lower into a higher level spell. For example, you can take two 1st level spell slots to make one 2nd level, or one 2nd level and one 1st level to make one 3rd level spell slot. You cannot create a spell slot level higher than your highest level spell slot.
You cannot create more spell slots than the maximum amount you can normally possess.
You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses after a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Aspect of Fate Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Aspect of Fate.

classFeature.name: Fateful Divination
entries: Upon reaching 7th level, you can cast the {@spell Divination} spell without expending a spell slot once. You regain the ability to do so again after you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Aspect of Fate Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Aspect of Fate.

classFeature.name: Prediction of Fate
entries: Starting at 11th level, you gain the ability to predict an enemy’s movements through your divination prowess. As a reaction, you can expend one of your divination dice to force a creature you can see within 60 feet of you, or yourself, to reroll an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw. The creature must use the new result, even if they have a feature that allows them to reroll. When they roll, they do so with either advantage if it was a weal die, or disadvantage if it was woe. Once you’ve used this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Aspect of Fate Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Aspect of Fate.

classFeature.name: Magic of the Weave
entries: You draw power from the infinite wellspring of magic, granting you the knowledge, wisdom, or cunning needed to learn magic you otherwise could not learn. Beginning at 15th level, choose two spells from any classes, including this one. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, as shown on the Fate Weaver table, or a cantrip. These spells are always prepared and do not count against your total number of prepared spells. You can choose another two spells when you reach 20th level, which are also always prepared and do not count towards your total number of prepared spells.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Aspect of Fate Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Aspect of Fate.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Boon of the Weave
entries: At 20th level, you have become the right hand of the Goddess of Magic. Your ability to manipulate the weave and call upon it is unrivaled, gaining the power to alter the very fabric of reality.
When you roll initiative while you have no fate dice, you regain an amount equal to your Charisma modifier.
In addition, you’ve gained the ability to warp time and reality around you. By spending 10 fate dice, choose one of the following effects:

entries.name: Alter Reality
entries: As an action, choose any one event from the previous 24 hours. By the DM’s discretion, you can alter specifications of the event, changing failures to success and vice versa. If the event includes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can treat that roll as the maximum possible result or the minimum possible result, treating any damage or healing that would come thereafter accordingly.

You can alter reality in various ways outside of the provided format above, one example being replacing a player character’s position with that of another player or NPC. The DM has the final say over what can or cannot be done depending on your campaign.

entries.name: Fate Wish
entries: You can duplicate any 9th level or lower spell, You don't need to meet any requirements in that spell, including costly components. The spell simply takes effect. The casting time of the spell becomes an action if it wasn’t already. For the purposes of determining the spell’s level, it is treated as a 10th level epic spell. Epic spells cannot be dispelled by non-epic spells and cannot be counterspelled by non-epic spells. They are also immune to antimagic zones not created by epic spells.

entries.name: Restoration of the Weave
entries: As an action, you can restore 10 levels worth of spell slots and you roll the fate dice spent by this feature and regain hit points equal to the result.

Using any of these effects other than duplicating a spell takes a huge toll on your body and mind as altering the fabric of reality has its downsides. When next you complete a short or long rest, you receive the stress a Wish spell would provide if you were to do anything other than duplicate a spell.
If you were to duplicate a spell, you instead suffer a level of exhaustion that can only be restored after a long rest.
Once you have used one of these effects, you cannot use another effect until you have completed a long rest or, if you suffered the stress of this ability, until your stress has recovered.

classFeature.name: Draconic Origin
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you have draconic blood running through your veins as part of your draconic inheritance. You gain the following benefits:
You learn how to speak, read, and write draconic. If you already have draconic from another source, you can choose one other language.

Choose either chromatic, gem, or metallic, then choose from either black, blue, green, red, or white for chromatic. Brass, bronze, copper, gold, or silver for metallic. These determine your draconic origin, what type of dragon is responsible for your powers, and what type of scales riddle your body.
Depending on your choice, you gain resistance to a specific damage type.
If you choose metallic, you gain proficiency in your choice of either an artisan’s tool or a musical instrument.
If you choose chromatic, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills: deception, intimidation, performance, or persuasion.
If you choose gem, you can speak, read, and write in one other language of your choosing from the common or exotic languages.

classFeature.name: Draconic Powers
entries: Also at 1st level you learn the ancient secrets of dragons. You gain additional powers as shown in the Draconic Powers column in the Dragon Warrior Table.

classFeature.name: Draconic Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature granted by your Draconic Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at fifth level, when you take the attack action on your turn you can make an additional weapon attack.

classFeature.name: Draconic Archetype Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Draconic Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
